options.D: Given that it is a heritable factor, it usually only needs to be measured once in a lifetime.

fdfb9ac8-4584-4d49-90fa-2a22e021d158.question: A 75-year-old woman with a history of chronic venous insufficiency came to the emergency room for unilateral infrapatellar edema of the right lower extremity, and was diagnosed with deep venous thrombosis of the right twin veins. Given that she has no other comorbidity or symptoms of pulmonary embolism, discharge from the hospital is being considered, along with treatment and follow-up in outpatient clinics. Which of these drugs is the LEAST suitable to start anticoagulant treatment?:

bb1d9842-a360-464b-a1d8-1352027f132e.question: A 78-year-old man with a history of paroxysmal atrial fibrillation, high blood pressure, and dyslipidemia. He has been undergoing treatment for years with acenocoumarol, amiodarone, candesartan, and pitavastatin. Pitavastatin is the third statin he has taken due to persistent elevation of CK and poor control of dyslipidemia. For several months, he has reported constipation, asthenia, and adynamia, hair loss, and general discomfort without myalgia. He provides an analysis with CK 1200 U/L (normal up to 171 U/L), normal kidney function, and cLDL 108 mg/dL despite treatment. Select the correct statement:

options.A: Another lipid-lowering agent, such as a PCSK9 inhibitor, needs to be added.
options.C: A dietary supplement needs to be added.
options.D: The statin needs to be switched to low-dose rosuvastatin.

490f4681-f7b3-4b24-9f0f-0ea2f292d080.question: A 23 year-old woman who began experiencing symptoms of asthenia and low-grade fever six months ago, and in the last month added pain in the right upper extremity, especially with movement and sustained elevation. Upon physical examination, a murmur was detected in the right supraclavicular area, a decrease in the right radial pulse, and a decrease in blood pressure of 30 mmHg in this limb compared to the left. The ESR was 20 mm and the biochemistry and blood count did not show significant alterations. With the initial diagnostic suspicion of large vessel vasculitis, indicate the incorrect response:

options.A: Some patients have established arterial stenosis that is casually detected in an inactive phase.
options.B: Its peripheral vascular manifestations are vascular murmurs, decrease in pulses, and limb claudication in more than half of the patients.
options.C: The normal ESR would rule out the suspected diagnosis.
options.D: An angiographic study with magnetic resonance is very useful in its diagnosis, as it provides information on the vascular lumen and the inflammatory involvement of the wall of the aorta and its main branches.

ed2fc74d-80c1-45ab-a3e0-966a2b311f3d.question: A 45-year-old patient has recently been diagnosed with pulmonary tuberculosis due to a characteristic clinical picture, a cavitary lesion in the chest X-ray, and a positive bacilloscopy. He reports that this is his second episode of pulmonary tuberculosis, having suffered another one 6 years ago. The clinical course is slow resolving and resistance to isoniazid is identified in the resistance study. The best treatment among the following is:

options.A: Rifampicin, isoniazid, pyrazinamide, and ethambutol for 18 months.
options.B: Rifampicin, pyrazinamide, ethambutol and levofloxacin for 6 months.
options.C: Rifampicin, bedaquiline and protionamide for 12 months.
options.D: Rifampicin, ethambutol, pyrazinamide and linezolid for three months.

69fa385b-8823-4306-8c12-6ead26e19c28.question: The nursing team alerts you about a patient admitted with a lung adenocarcinoma with bone metastases. Their pain treatment includes oral extended-release morphine and also provides for the administration, in the form of rescue medication, of intravenous morphine chloride every 4 hours if the patient requires it. The nurses' perception is that they are in pain, but their family member requests that morphine chloride not be administered as a painkiller because "I don't want to see him asleep". Which of the following options would be the first to carry out in this situation?:

options.A: Accept the family member's request and prescribe a non-opioid analgesic for pain control.
options.B: Reject the family member's request and order the administration of morphine chloride, at the previously prescribed doses.
options.C: Suggest rotating the analgesic treatment to another opioid with less sedative risk, such as oxycodone/naloxone.
options.D: Ask the patient about the intensity of their current pain and their analgesia preferences at this time.

4192731c-c625-4dde-bbe6-cbbe0c042455.question: A 73-year-old man diagnosed 8 months ago with an adenocarcinoma of the prostate with bone metastases, undergoing hormone therapy. He goes to the emergency room due to an increase in dorsolumbar pain that does not subside with the prescribed medication. Up to this point, he was being treated with fentanyl in a transdermal patch of 25 mcg/h every 72 hours and metamizole in case of pain, but for about 48 hours it has not relieved the pain, which he describes as continuous, dull, that worsens with movement and similar to the base pain but with greater intensity. In this context, point out the incorrect answer:

options.A: In the case of pain due to bone metastases, the use of anti-inflammatory drugs such as NSAIDs or corticosteroids is indicated as adjuvant treatment.
options.B: In neuropathic pain, anticonvulsant drugs such as gabapentin are indicated as adjuncts.
options.C: Given that the patient uses fentanyl as a base opioid, if we decide to prescribe a rescue opioid, it must also be fentanyl as third-step analgesic drugs should not be mixed.
options.D: Radiotherapy for pain relief is an option for patients with bone metastases from prostate neoplasms.

8a654ecb-169a-4391-8ae5-461e41e225cf.question: In palliative care, the aim is to use the fewest possible number of drugs. In some cases, this is feasible given that some of the medications indicated for a certain symptom also have a beneficial effect for another. Indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: The Buscopan that is used to decrease bronchial secretions at the end of life is also used to prevent or decrease constipation.
options.B: The morphine that is prescribed for moderate-severe pain has a significant positive effect in reducing the sensation of dyspnea.
options.C: The dexamethasone that is used as an anti-inflammatory is also used to improve appetite.
options.D: The haloperidol used to alleviate the agitation of delirium can be used as an antiemetic, although in smaller doses.

7735e3cf-4a2e-4671-a594-d00cd784cf7e.question: 79-year-old female with advanced COPD and an FEV1 of 20%, with dyspnea from minimal exertion and repeated episodes of resting dyspnea without a clear triggering cause. She has lost 8 kg in the last 6 months. She has been treated with repeated cycles of antibiotics, intensification of bronchodilation, inhaled corticosteroids, codeine, and oxygen therapy without response. There is consideration to introduce morphine into the treatment. What would be the correct response?:

options.A: It is not recommended as it depresses the respiratory center and does not improve dyspnea.
options.B: It is only indicated when the O2 saturation, without oxygen therapy, remains below 90%.
options.C: It is indicated because there are clear symptoms and signs of severe worsening and poor prognosis.
options.D: It would only be indicated when there is evidence of severe respiratory failure measured by arterial blood gas.

53b123f0-592a-42b7-8690-7089d727dc76.question: In carbon monoxide (CO) poisoning, the oxygen in hemoglobin is replaced by the CO molecule. Regarding the circumstances in which this poisoning presents in the clinic, only one of the following statements is true:

options.A: The suicidal etiology of CO poisoning is exceptional.
options.B: CO poisoning is not included in the list of occupational diseases, as when it occurs, it does so accidentally.
options.C: CO is a colorless gas but has a characteristic bitter almond smell.
options.D: A common source of CO (carbon monoxide) production is the poor combustion of liquefied gases (propane, butane, etc.).

d895bf10-db87-4e0e-8670-243a6bd6d9d0.question: A 39-year-old man visits the doctor due to weakness and altered sensation in both lower extremities accompanied by double vision. Among the possible diagnoses is multiple sclerosis. In relation to this disease, indicate the incorrect response:

options.A: In most cases, the onset is between the ages of 20 and 40 and it affects men more frequently than women.
options.B: In its etiopathogenesis, studies indicate that there is a polygenic susceptibility.
options.C: The most common symptom is a change in sensitivity, in the form of paresthesias or numbness in one or more limbs or the trunk.
options.D: The characteristic lesion is the plaque or focal lesion of perivenous demyelination, with variable inflammation and axonal loss.

b7718647-7147-45c7-be70-24949c741fc7.question: Which of the following drugs should we avoid in an elderly patient with diabetes mellitus?:

fdd18565-87da-46d9-a5d1-7e6c458f4c19.question: Regarding the ankle-brachial index, indicate the correct answer:

options.A: It is obtained by calculating the ratio between the diastolic pressure in the ankle and the brachial diastolic pressure.
options.B: It is considered normal if values between 1 and 1.5 are obtained.
options.C: It has a sensitivity of 95% and a specificity of 60% for the diagnosis of peripheral arterial disease.
options.D: It is considered an indicator in itself of arteriosclerotic disease.

33035a42-be24-4902-9e29-03f14c82acbf.question: Which of the following drugs or therapeutic groups are preferably indicated in a patient with diabetes mellitus and obesity (BMI greater than 30) for secondary cardiovascular prevention?:

2e6a007e-0122-44cc-a544-cef8ba1436a8.question: According to the Preventive Activities and Health Promotion Program of the semFyC, as well as the US Preventive Task Force and the American Cancer Society, from what age is it recommended, with a type A recommendation, to begin colorectal cancer screening tests in the asymptomatic general population?

5a135fbc-cf30-4cd0-9a5c-abd79c783d80.question: In addressing smoking as a risk factor and as the leading preventable cause of death, disease, and disability in industrialized societies, it's important to consider many aspects. Indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: Primary care is the most favorable environment for detecting tobacco use, providing brief advice, facilitating smoking cessation, and promoting quit strategies.
options.B: The detection and treatment of tobacco dependence is considered an intervention with favorable cost-effectiveness, without repercussion in terms of cost per year of life gained.
options.C: In terms of assistance in quitting smoking, evidence supports both non-pharmacological strategies (brief intervention or motivational support) and pharmacological strategies, with the combination of both being the most effective.
options.D: Smokers who do not want to attempt to quit tobacco may lack adequate information about its harmful effects, have erroneous beliefs, or be demoralized due to having relapsed.

2f61cce9-ed1f-4859-9deb-7beea0ab649c.question: An 82-year-old patient with peripheral polyarthritis and stress urinary incontinence. She cares for her 84-year-old husband with Alzheimer's disease. The husband calls the neighbor because his wife is very drowsy and has not prepared him breakfast. Her family doctor visits her at home and observes that she is disoriented, with dry mucous membranes and difficulty walking, with no other neurological focus. Upon reviewing her medical history, it is noted that she was attended to two days ago by the nighttime emergency service for feeling dizzy and was prescribed Sulpiride. Given this clinical situation, of the following, which would be the LEAST LIKELY cause in the differential diagnosis?

options.A: Delirium due to urinary tract infection.

c584824a-c480-4b82-a835-091cd49c55b0.question: A 78-year-old male presents to the emergency room with general deterioration, increased abdominal circumference, interrupted urination, tenesmus, and increased urinary frequency associated with predominantly nocturnal urinary incontinence that has been ongoing for 5 days. He reports a history of diabetes mellitus being treated with metformin. He is afebrile and normotensive. His blood work shows a glucose level of 345 mg/dl, creatinine 2.9 mg/dl (0.7-1.3), urea 79 mg/dl (17-49), and urinalysis reveals nitrites, leukocytes, and microscopic hematuria. On examination, a palpable mass is found along the midline, below the umbilicus. What would be the initial approach based on his suspected diagnosis?

80a063e9-a1db-4923-a72b-1f95fc4edd9f.question: Indicate which of the following statements is not correct when suspecting botulism in a patient who goes to the emergency room after consuming packaged food from a brand responsible for an outbreak detected in several parts of Spain:

options.A: You must be admitted with support measures and immediate administration of botulinum antitoxin.
options.B: The characteristic syndrome initially consists of the symmetric paralysis of the cranial nerves.
options.C: It is accompanied by ascending symmetric spastic paralysis and hyperreflexia.
options.D: The incubation period is usually 8-36 hours after ingestion, but it can be up to 10 days.

1fb7f29c-73b7-4ffa-9113-de5149d152b0.question: A 65-year-old patient with acute lymphoblastic leukemia presents to the emergency department after having a bout of nausea, vomiting, neuromuscular irritability, altered level of consciousness, acute renal failure, hyperuricemia, hyperkalemia, hyperphosphatemia and hypocalcemia 48 hours post chemotherapy session. The most probable initial suspected diagnosis is:

options.D: Metabolic alteration secondary to post-chemotherapy hyperemesis.

54cc9d6c-13ee-4f7c-8b8f-f4bfff7ebcc0.question: High-grade serous carcinomas of the ovary originate from:

options.A: Epithelium of the fimbriae of the Fallopian tube.
options.B: Epithelium of endometriosis cyst glands of the ovary.

be6a7201-2c98-456b-aceb-9810d6cf1a17.question: A 35-year-old man with a history of asthma and allergies to non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs. He reports that since childhood, he has had skin lesions located on the face and skin folds, accompanied by intense itching, which he was able to control with emollients and topical corticosteroids. However, over the last 5 years, he has been worsening with increased itching and a significant expansion of his lesions. Therefore, he has received several rounds of oral corticosteroids, cyclosporine, and methotrexate with partial and insufficient response. Given this situation, which of the following biological drugs is indicated?:

0210d13c-356a-442c-88e1-635a5ea3556a.question: Of the following statements in relation to psoriasis, which one is correct?:

options.A: The Koebner phenomenon indicates that psoriasis is a disease associated with metabolic and joint comorbidities.
options.B: The primary systemic treatment for palmoplantar psoriasis is based on short cycles of oral corticosteroids.
options.C: Psoriasis is a chronic immune-mediated disorder, with autosomal recessive inheritance and environmental triggering factors, such as trauma, infections, medications, or psychological stress.
options.D: The typical histological findings include acanthosis with elongated ridges, hypogranulosis, hyper and parakeratosis, dilated vessels and aggregates of neutrophils in the epidermis.

7619043b-fb84-438a-8c39-f285e9a7b45f.question: A 71-year-old woman with phototype II and intense actinic damage and a personal history of in situ melanoma on the back, three basal cell carcinomas on the face, and a squamous cell carcinoma on the arm. She consults about a pigmented lesion on the leg. After the removal of the lesion, the histopathology shows a superficial spreading melanoma Breslow 0.6 millimeters without ulceration or regression. What is the recommended course of action?:

options.A: Perform a surgery with a 1 cm margin expansion.
options.B: Perform a surgery with a 1 cm margin expansion and sentinel lymph node biopsy.
options.C: Given that it is a second melanoma, it requires treatment with the targeted therapy dabrafenib + trametinib.
options.D: Given that you have multiple types of skin cancer, you could benefit from immunotherapy treatment, such as nivolumab or pembrolizumab.

9f2b78e7-9b28-497c-93fc-3ea300c986c8.question: Which of the following is not a hormonal response to hypoglycemia?:

6dbfbb12-84b2-408f-b4d5-81328820f016.question: After the diagnosis in emergency of pulmonary embolism, it is necessary to perform a risk assessment and stratification to decide what is the best therapeutic option. Indicate which of the following is a high risk factor for having an adverse clinical outcome:

options.A: Extension of pulmonary embolism with normal right ventricle function and normotension.
options.B: Identification on the thoracic CT of signs of left ventricle growth.
options.D: Signs of right ventricular dysfunction in the echocardiogram with sustained systolic blood pressure <90 mmHg.

c6ff52f2-af7c-487f-afd5-07f8975e0fc8.question: In a patient with metastatic colon cancer, which of the following molecular determinations should be made before starting systemic treatment?:

options.A: EGFR, NRAS, KRAS, repair proteins, HER2.
options.C: EGFR, NRAS, KRAS, BRAF, repair proteins.
options.D: NRAS, KRAS, BRAF, repair proteins, PI3K.

e3ec3f0a-f841-4f77-9fb7-9b9f36753f04.question: A 45-year-old man who in the last 6 weeks has shown asthenia, weight loss of 5 kg, and arthromyalgia predominantly in the proximal region of both lower limbs, along with asymmetric hypoesthesia in hands and feet. In addition, in the last 3 days, he has developed a livedo reticularis and several erythematous and painful subcutaneous nodules on the front of both legs. His test results highlight ESR (Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate) 90 mm/h (normal <20) and C-reactive protein 12 mg/dl (normal <1.0). A chest x-ray is normal. Electroneuromyography (ENMG): findings are consistent with multiple mononeuritis. Considering the most probable diagnosis, mark the correct option:

options.A: Unlike what is observed in the patient, the most characteristic alteration of the ENMG is a small fiber neuropathy.
options.B: A muscle biopsy would not allow histologically demonstrating the disease.
options.C: Despite the diagnostic suspicion, the patient does not meet the classification criteria for the disease, so it is not possible to diagnose them.
options.D: There are patients who meet the classification criteria for the disease who have loss-of-function mutations in the CECR1 gene that encodes adenosine deaminase 2.

7c3bcac9-67aa-4fdb-ae1e-9a071be09ca1.question: A 26-year-old patient with no notable medical history presented with thickening and color change of the distal part of the right big toe nail. Upon examination, a very likely onychomycosis of the nail was observed, with no other lesions or affected nails. It is true that the following applies to this clinical situation:

options.A: Treatment with topical amorolfine at 5% twice a week for a period of 3 months is usually effective.
options.B: If the injury affects the nail matrix, the treatment should be extended to 6-9 months.
options.C: The oral treatment of choice in this case is griseofulvin.
options.D: In cases of resistance, one option is treatment with oral itraconazole 200 mg every 24 hours for 12 weeks.

828a61b8-6f90-4861-b2ce-fd5f69f71bb4.question: A 67-year-old former smoker female with a history of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus of 10 years duration with microalbuminuria and obesity is sent to your clinic. She provides an analysis with a glycated hemoglobin of 10%, a total cholesterol of 210 mg/dL, non-calculable LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol of 30 mg/dL and triglycerides of 496 mg/dL. Normal kidney function. With respect to hypertriglyceridemia, indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The first step is to achieve adequate control of your diabetes to correct hypertriglyceridemia and add a statin.
options.B: Although diabetes control is necessary, it does not influence hypertriglyceridemia. The first step is to add omega-3 fatty acids.
options.C: The first treatment option is to combine gemfibrozil with a statin.
options.D: The first option is to start treatment with fibrates.

ce995887-b87d-465f-ae57-a9103f72ebc3.question: Regarding the withdrawal of life support measures in cases of treatment futility in a terminally ill patient, which of the following statements is true?:

options.A: It is ethically acceptable, even if it results in the patient's death.
options.B: This is a measure that fundamentally depends on the willingness of the physician in charge of the patient.
options.C: It is a mistaken and obsolete practice since there exist sophisticated means of artificial life support.
options.D: According to Spanish law, it's euthanasia.

268b64b5-9c5c-4dd1-92cf-77fd4321d7dd.question: The subcutaneous route is greatly useful in the treatment of patients in palliative care, and it is considered the choice when the oral route is not possible. However, there are drugs whose use by subcutaneous route is not advised. One of those drugs is:

4eaf2e7d-4eaa-43bc-964b-79b26331a719.question: The medical death certificate (MDC) is a legal-administrative document necessary to obtain the burial license for the body of a deceased person. If there is a reasonable suspicion that the person has died as a result of pneumonia caused by a COVID-19 infection, which of the following statements is true?:

options.A: In the CMD, it will be noted that the corpse belongs to group I, due to presenting an infectious disease that poses a significant risk to public health.
options.B: The CMD cannot be completed as it involves a suspected criminal death.
options.C: The CMD cannot be completed because there are only presumptive criteria available and not confirmatory ones, even though the circumstances of the death and the pathological history are compatible.
options.D: The COVID-19 infection will be noted in the section for underlying cause and not in the section for immediate cause.

f1307c75-68f7-491d-8e9a-2972799a2884.question: In a patient with nephrotic syndrome, it is possible to find one of the following plasma alterations in the lipoprotein profile:

options.A: Decrease in very low density lipoproteins (VLDL).

67bef29d-fe4e-46f0-a0cb-e816fae88374.question: In relation to the metabolism of nitrogen compounds, the skeletal muscle is capable of:

options.A: Synthesize urea in a limited way in situations of liver dysfunction to alleviate the toxicity of ammonia.
options.B: Use alpha-keto acids derived from branched-chain amino acids as an energy source.
options.C: Produce alanine by transamination from pyruvate and aspartic acid, particularly in certain fasting situations.
options.D: Produce creatine using glycine, ATP, and ammonia to obtain creatine-phosphate as an energy reserve and enable its use during exercise.

8c119da3-a722-4e02-84bf-a1140a9c6c62.question: In type Ia glycogen storage disease (von Gierke's disease) due to glucose-6-phosphatase deficiency, it is characteristic:

options.B: Hypouricemia due to reduction in the renal reabsorption of uric acid.
options.D: The reduction of hepatic synthesis of triglycerides.

f951a693-fb7b-4b8e-8b50-945ea0487a30.question: In relation to the pressures that cause the inflow and outflow of air in the lungs in a healthy person, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: The continuous aspiration of excess fluids towards the lymphatic ducts maintains a slight negative pressure between the visceral surface of the lung and the parietal pleural surface of the thoracic cavity.
options.B: During normal inspiration, the pleural pressure becomes more negative.
options.C: During normal exhalation, the alveolar pressure decreases compared to the value of atmospheric pressure.
options.D: The transpulmonary pressure (alveolar pressure minus pleural pressure) tends to collapse the lungs during the complete respiratory cycle.

74be9b3d-5835-4d55-9302-3fadf9385d52.question: Turbulent blood flow tends to increase in direct proportion to all the following factors except one. Indicate which one:

56c8ebf6-a27c-4426-876e-b75f8bb5c585.question: In relation to the regulation of fluid exchange and osmotic balance between intracellular and extracellular fluids in a physiological situation, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: The distribution of fluid between the intracellular and extracellular compartments is primarily determined by the osmotic effect of the smallest ions.
options.B: Around 80% of the total osmolarity of the interstitial fluid and plasma is due to sodium and chlorine ions.
options.C: Around 50% of the osmolarity in the intracellular fluid is due to calcium ions.
options.D: Relatively small changes in the concentration of non-diffusible solutes in the extracellular fluid can cause large changes in cell volume.

0e241e79-42ee-4e78-9b66-aa161456204e.question: Indicate the correct answer regarding renal reabsorption of sodium:

options.A: In the ascending loop of Henle, sodium is reabsorbed, without reabsorbing water.
options.B: In the collecting tubule, 20% of the sodium is reabsorbed.
options.C: The highest reabsorption of sodium occurs in the distal tubule.
options.D: The reabsorption of sodium in the proximal tubule is mediated by aldosterone.

c3c4010d-cc73-4b27-9de8-fe7a09ec78a4.question: What is the term for the progressively earlier onset and increase in severity of clinical manifestations of a disease over successive generations?

797d53b7-8498-4370-a4fd-56eceec7e270.question: Regarding the role of Immunoglobulin A (IgA) in defense against pathogens, indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: IgA activates the classical complement pathway, contributing to the elimination of extracellular bacteria.
options.B: IgA passes from the mother to the newborn during breastfeeding, contributing to the protection of the neonate's mucous membranes.
options.C: IgA can cross the epithelial barrier of the mucous membranes by binding to the poly-Ig receptor (pIgR), making it the most abundant immunoglobulin in the mucous membranes.
options.D: Selective IgA deficiency is the most common immunodeficiency (approximately 1:400) and most cases are asymptomatic.

1a506f5f-64ef-456c-b1fc-72267a75ce7d.question: Among the new protective measures against COVID-19 is the use of therapies based on monoclonal antibodies against the S (spike) protein of SARS-CoV-2 (tixagevimab and cilgavimab). This treatment:

options.A: It is a form of active immunization whose result depends on the activation of memory lymphocytes.
options.B: It is indicated for immunocompromised patients, such as those with organ transplants.
options.C: Provides protection for an approximate period of two years.
options.D: Induces immunological memory based on the activation of B lymphocytes.

fed0f537-f20a-4930-bf81-b8872f06ab9c.question: Regulatory T cells (CD4+, CD25+, FoxP3+) are often found in the infiltration of solid tumors. These cells:

options.A: They are considered markers of good prognosis in the development of the tumor.
options.B: They contribute to the antitumor immune defense.
options.C: They produce gamma interferon which contributes to the activation of cytotoxic lymphocytes.
options.D: They produce interleukin-10 which contributes to an immunosuppressive tumor microenvironment.

c27f9a92-949a-471d-86fb-24fe412ecbe7.question: The Hyper-IgM syndrome, a primary immunodeficiency associated with different mutations in the CD40 molecules or its ligand CD40L, is characterized because:

options.A: The patients present elevated levels of IgM while maintaining normal levels of IgG and IgA in serum.
options.B: They present a defect in the differentiation of B lymphocytes in the bone marrow with an increase in immature B lymphocytes that express the intracytoplasmic mu chain.
options.C: There is a defect in the collaboration process between T and B lymphocytes necessary for the isotype switch of immunoglobulins.
options.D: There is a defect in the rearrangement process of the V genes of immunoglobulins.

25ddb43c-ae9b-40bb-9695-ed1053c41960.question: Among the advances in antitumor immunotherapy is the use of modified T lymphocytes to express a CAR receptor (chimeric antigen receptor), known as CAR-T. In relation to CAR-T cells for the treatment of lymphomas and leukemias that express CD19, indicate the incorrect response:

options.A: The recognition element of the CAR receptor is based on variable fragments of anti-CD19 antibodies (single-chain variable fragments, scFvs).
options.B: The CAR receptor has an intracellular domain responsible for signal transmission.
options.C: Among the serious side effects of this treatment is the cytokine release syndrome.
options.D: The recognition of the antigen by the CAR receptor depends on class I histocompatibility (HLA) molecules on the tumor cell.

a15e0385-3f1a-4196-a590-5742aab8e542.question: A 50-year-old beekeeper presenting severe systemic reactions (anaphylaxis) after bee stings, tested positive for Apis mellifera venom through skin tests in intradermal reaction and specific IgE in serum. What is the indicated etiological treatment?

options.A: Patient training in the use of adrenaline auto-injectors.
options.B: Patient education in the use of orally disintegrating antihistamines, pressurized aerosol bronchodilators, and oral corticosteroids.
options.C: Subcutaneous specific immunotherapy with 100% Apis mellifera extract.
options.D: Use of immunomodulatory drugs like oral cyclosporine.

f3aa6578-70d0-4b1b-8799-2a7cb6b335bc.question: In a genetic disease with an autosomal recessive inheritance pattern, the risk of the disease in future offspring when both parents are carriers is:

options.A: 25% in each pregnancy regardless of the sex of the offspring.
options.B: 50% in each pregnancy of a male child.
options.C: 50% in each pregnancy of a daughter.
options.D: 50% in each pregnancy regardless of the offspring's sex.

1d53ef41-f7e3-4f29-ac1a-271636a1e1fc.question: In a particular gene, the DNA sequence is transcribed to form mature RNA and this mature RNA is translated to form the protein. What region (sequence) of a gene's structure is called an intron?

options.A: To the one that initiates the transcription to form the RNA.
options.B: To the one that is not present in mature RNA.
options.C: The one that is transcribed to be present in the mature RNA and give rise to the protein.
options.D: To the one that regulates the expression of the gene.

9a5555ca-6037-471c-ba5f-65a1687b6e2f.question: To determine whether the regular consumption of ultra-processed foods (e.g. sausages) is associated with a higher risk of frailty syndrome in older adults, 5,000 people over the age of 70 who live in their own homes are selected. They are asked about their regular diet and the consumption of ultra-processed foods is identified in each of them. A follow-up is carried out for 3 years to identify those who develop frailty syndrome for the first time. Indicate the correct answer about the design of this study:

options.A: It is a cohort study, because subjects are followed according to their exposure to identify the risk of a health problem.
options.B: It's a field trial, because it is conducted with individuals who are not patients.
options.C: It is an ecological study, because it includes a very large population group.
options.D: It is a case-control study, in which the cases consume many ultra-processed foods and the controls consume very few.

a05b06e4-5f67-4ddf-bfc2-e7cd3626b810.question: Regarding systematic errors in observational studies, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: They are classified into selection biases, information biases, and analysis biases.
options.B: These can be avoided by increasing the sample size.
options.C: They can modify the magnitude of the effect being investigated.
options.D: They can affect the internal validity of the study.

82c68525-f7da-49a4-8b83-211d96f779e4.question: The negative predictive value of a diagnostic test is 92%. How should this result be interpreted?:

options.A: Out of every 100 negative results, 92 will correspond to healthy individuals.
options.B: Out of every 100 healthy people, the test result will be negative for 92 of them.
options.C: Out of every 100 patients, the test result will be negative for 8 of them.
options.D: Out of every 100 positive results, 8 of them will correspond to sick individuals.

8a415322-9bc2-42c4-bbe4-b6c8b1ca31ec.question: The reason why an intervention has a "strong" recommendation level in a clinical practice guide is that:

options.A: It has more benefits than risks.
options.B: It is based on a high level of evidence.
options.D: It is the preferred one by the patients.

85d44abe-9d64-406b-8c20-2f0075684afc.question: In which of the following diseases should we apply contact and airborne (aerosols) isolation precautions?:

12c9ea13-d158-4a1f-95b9-43b32352c3d9.question: In the forest plot diagram that shows the results of a systematic review of studies, the square that appears next to each study is:

options.B: The estimator of interest (such as the relative risk) from each study.
options.C: The confidence interval of the estimator of interest in each study.
options.D: The weight of each study when conducting a meta-analysis of said studies.

fb43f08f-a4f3-42ff-904e-a370bede333c.question: In the assessment of the risk of bias in an epidemiological study, one of the following criteria is considered:

options.B: The excessive width of the 95% confidence interval of the main result of the study.
options.C: The lack of statistical significance of the results.
options.D: Measurement errors in some of the main variables.

d7854bc2-6763-4317-92bf-2d5a3db32230.question: The best preventive strategy to slow the progression of the disease in a smoker diagnosed with COPD is to achieve the goal of tobacco cessation. The following measure is not included in the current first-choice protocols for the treatment of tobacco abstinence reinforcement, because there are no demonstrative studies on its clinical efficacy and safety:

options.A: These are combined virus and bacteria vaccines made to be less immunogenic and cause fewer side effects.
options.B: These are whole virus vaccines conjugated with a polysaccharide to be able to combine them and make the trivalent or tetravalent viral vaccine.
options.C: They are bacterial vaccines conjugated with a polysaccharide in order to combine them and create penta or hexavalent vaccines.
options.D: They are polysaccharide vaccines conjugated with a protein to make it T-cell dependent and achieve long-term immunological memory.

732dba22-3464-4d5b-a9a9-7132dd7f23eb.question: A clinical trial in which participants are randomly assigned to one of several clinical interventions is known as:

1be17001-7d50-4402-b832-af88b4a6b957.question: In the management of a pregnant woman diagnosed with bipolar disorder, which of the following drugs is effective in this disease and has been established as safer during pregnancy?

90e72870-bb39-43c9-ba3d-886eb389c0fa.question: A 69-year-old patient diagnosed with lymphoma has been prescribed intravenous treatment with methotrexate. On the third day of treatment, the patient presents nephrotoxicity and delayed renal elimination of the drug with a urinary pH less than 7. Taking into account the chemical nature of methotrexate (pKa between 4 and 5.5), which of the following actions would be the most correct to handle the toxicity?:

options.A: Intravenous administration of physiological saline with ammonium chloride to facilitate the renal elimination of methotrexate.
options.B: Intravenous administration of sodium bicarbonate solution to accelerate methotrexate diuresis.
options.C: Enteral administration of sodium bicarbonate solution to reduce the digestive absorption of methotrexate.
options.D: Intravenous administration of furosemide in serum with a neutral pH to induce forced diuresis.

b4536808-3087-4078-9d97-0612f814f17d.question: What is the mechanism by which ivabradine, acting on the cells of the sinoatrial node, produces a decrease in heart rate?

options.A: It enhances repolarization by activating potassium outflow currents.
options.C: It blocks the If pacemaker current.

e2069a51-b402-469c-b3d2-c781d415bf86.question: In a patient with a duodenal ulcer and high cardiovascular risk due to ischemic heart disease, if they require treatment with a NSAID, which of the following would you recommend as the safest?:

ae924fe6-a01b-47dd-80bc-3997a887f932.question: A 68-year-old male with a history of obesity and type 2 diabetes mellitus, being treated with metformin. He is admitted due to a first episode of heart failure. He has a glycated hemoglobin of 8.5%. To optimize the treatment of diabetes at discharge, which of the following drugs is contraindicated?:

7e46fd76-e942-4efd-910d-457e63a099b1.question: A 5-year-old boy who suffered a bicycle accident with facial trauma without loss of consciousness, was observed in the emergency room with only a wound on his chin, which was sutured. He was referred for a consultation 5 days after the trauma due to limited and deviated mouth opening. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.B: Combined fracture of the jaw and upper maxilla.
options.D: Fracture of the symphysis and horizontal branch of the jaw.

43d53942-1b9a-4791-b9e3-6e86f382d4b1.question: Of the following malignant tumors that can affect the tongue, which is the most frequent type and where does it usually metastasize?:

options.A: The sarcoma metastasizes in the cervical lymph nodes.
options.B: The squamous cell carcinoma metastasizes in the cervical lymph nodes.
options.C: The sarcoma metastasizes to distant bone tissue.
options.D: The squamous cell carcinoma metastasizes in liver tissue.

87a874bd-e60f-4397-9f9b-d5a11a5d546f.question: Which of the following descriptions defines stage II of a pressure ulcer according to the staging system of the National Pressure Injury Advisory Panel?

options.B: Total thickness loss of skin with exposure of subcutaneous cellular tissue.
options.C: Loss of epidermis with exposure of the dermis.
options.D: Appearance of granulation tissue in the defect bed.

797d2fe4-8f8a-44b9-b983-3f546b2347b7.question: Regarding skin grafts, indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: One of the beds considered graftable due to its rich vascularization is the granulation tissue.
options.B: We can classify them into partial skin grafts (if they only have the epidermis) or total skin grafts (if they have both the epidermis and underlying dermis).
options.C: They usually undergo a contraction process, which occurs both at the time of being extracted and after having been grafted.
options.D: Among the medical comorbidities associated with graft loss, we can highlight diabetes, smoking and peripheral vasculopathy.

db1b193d-f002-489a-aa4f-c06699655bb3.question: A 38-year-old woman has been experiencing a sensation of grittiness and burning in both eyes for several weeks, which worsens throughout the day, during windy conditions, and with air conditioning. What is the most likely diagnosis?

b22c3a0b-fe62-4767-b008-e6f0431a2103.question: Regarding posterior vitreous detachment, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: The symptoms for which patients usually consult are phosphenes and floaters.
options.B: The Weiss ring is a characteristic sign in the ophthalmoscopic examination.
options.C: The Shaffer's sign or tobacco dust is a sign of good prognosis.
options.D: It occurs due to the liquefaction of the vitreous gel due to age.

a47bb563-0b33-4de2-ad61-454d2d7bebc7.question: A 25-year-old male reports a significant decrease in night vision and poor adaptation to darkness in recent months. He is noticing difficulty driving, going down stairs, and has lately been tripping on curbs. However, he can read and watch television. Which of the following entities would you associate this patient's symptoms with?:

38f1b87d-0827-47d0-b842-5da272f1f46a.question: A 22-month-old child was treated for acute bilateral middle ear infection, which presented with pain, fever, discharge from the ear, and partial hearing loss. Oral antibiotics and topical drops were administered, improving the symptoms. Twelve days later, the child was brought to the emergency department again due to recurring fever, and the parents noticed that the earlobe has moved outwards and downwards and that the skin behind the ear is red and swollen. What is the most likely diagnosis?

9145cea9-33a1-44d3-b38b-aff707461ffa.question: A 40-year-old woman who presents with a spell of dizziness accompanied by nausea and vomiting, lasting about twenty minutes. She has not lost consciousness and has been able to hold onto a wall to maintain her balance. This has happened to her on previous occasions. She reports having felt a sense of fullness in her ears, tinnitus and hearing loss in her right ear. Physical examination reveals normal otoscopy, grade II leftward rotatory nystagmus, positive Romberg on the right, and Unterberger with rightward laterodeviation. What is the most likely diagnosis?

d067c955-cb1a-475e-9423-4edd35f5a07d.question: Oropharyngeal dysphagia is the difficulty in transferring food from the oral cavity to the proximal esophagus. Among the causes of motor oropharyngeal dysphagia are the following except:

dd31fde1-30d3-46de-9665-7ac42a5f07dc.question: In relation to vulvovaginal infections, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: Bacterial vaginosis is usually a monomicrobial infection.
options.B: Candidal vulvovaginitis is the most prevalent vulvovaginal infection in Europe.
options.C: It is defined as recurrent candidal vulvovaginitis when 4 or more episodes occur in a year.
options.D: Bacterial vaginosis should only be treated pharmacologically when it is symptomatic.

611d6dfd-ee0a-43c1-96c1-2dfea7349d87.question: Referring to polycystic ovary syndrome, point out the incorrect statement:

options.B: Clinically, it is characterized by the presence of hirsutism, acne, and amenorrhea or oligomenorrhea.
options.C: It is associated with obesity and insulin resistance.
options.D: Increases the risk of ovarian cancer.

2bf6aa93-199a-4ab2-a1cd-2d7c5f1b4504.question: A 35-year-old woman pregnant for the first time, who is in the second stage of labour. She is on epidural analgesia. When would it be appropriate to apply the vacuum to expedite the expulsion period?

options.A: When, after 2 hours in complete, the presentation remains in a Hodge's second plane with maternal efforts.
options.B: When witnessing a start of heavy vaginal bleeding with fetal repercussion and the presentation is on the upper narrow of the maternal pelvis.
options.C: When the presentation remains on a fourth plane and the guide point is the chin.
options.D: When fetal bradycardia occurs that does not recover after the cessation of contraction and the lesser fontanel is past the III Hodge plane.

05512dda-42ff-4e05-9424-7119fda09199.question: A 41-year-old pregnant woman at 13+2 weeks, after undergoing an ultrasound in the 12th week, presents a combined risk of chromosomal abnormalities for trisomy 21 of 1 in 30. What would be the most appropriate advice?

options.C: Reassure them because it is a combined risk that is low risk in any case.
options.D: Reassure him because it is an intermediate risk and it is justified by the maternal age.

3856b8c8-98c7-47a7-adac-c9e84081a12b.question: A primigravida at 26 weeks of gestation, with normal follow-up to date. She goes to her health center with an O´Sullivan test result of 175 mg/dL. Given this situation, how should we proceed?

options.A: She must be informed of the risk of gestational diabetes with fetal risk and referred to the hospital emergency service.
options.B: An oral glucose overload of 100 g will only be indicated if there are risk factors for alterations in glucose metabolism.
options.C: Being a value higher than 165 mg/dL confirms the diagnosis of gestational diabetes.
options.D: A diagnostic confirmation of gestational diabetes should be requested by conducting a 100 g oral glucose tolerance test.

c9fb9183-5bbe-4609-8220-5cef05378e73.question: A 36-year-old woman with a history of 2 first trimester miscarriages and severe preeclampsia which required a cesarean section due to fetal distress at 33 weeks of gestation. The postpartum analytical study is normal except for the presence of antiphospholipid antibodies IgM and IgG, the rest of the thrombophilia study being normal. The presence of antiphospholipid antibodies was confirmed 4 months after the first analysis. What recommendation would we make to this patient in case of a new pregnancy?

options.A: Aspirin and low molecular weight heparin at prophylactic doses.
options.C: Attempt conception through preimplantation genetic diagnosis.
options.D: Treatment according to first trimester preeclampsia screening with low-dose aspirin if high risk.

cbe53112-3f1b-4970-9a6e-b6807c8a9e23.question: 54-year-old nulliparous woman who consults due to urinary leakage after perceiving urinary urgency and the sensation of needing to urinate 3-4 times at night. In the gynecological examination, a first-degree cystocele and moderate vaginal atrophy are evident. What would be the initial measures to take?

options.B: Conducting a urinary diary and bladder retraining.
options.C: Indication for uroflowmetry and evaluation of urethral function.
options.D: Prescription of oral treatment with cholinergic drugs.

eb720c8d-1b85-43d1-9976-0e701342e62f.question: A 29-year-old primigravid with no noteworthy medical history has been referred at 36.5 weeks of gestation due to suspicion of growth restriction from ultrasound findings. In the consultation her blood pressure is 125/75 mmHg. The obstetric ultrasound shows an estimated fetal weight compatible with the 6th percentile for gestational age, and a Doppler pulsatility index of the umbilical artery above the 95th percentile. What recommendation would you make in this situation?

options.A: Immediate termination of pregnancy through a cesarean section.
options.B: Weekly check-ups with fetal monitoring and obstetric ultrasound every two weeks until the spontaneous onset of labor.
options.C: Weekly check-ups with fetal monitoring and obstetric ultrasound every two weeks until 40 weeks of gestation.
options.D: Induction of labor starting from the 37th week of gestation.

b1214c82-16b6-4359-b604-55a6bdd9dcf5.question: A 35-year-old woman presents with amenorrhea lasting 6 months. In the patient history, she states that she has recently been having difficulty sleeping and wakes up at night feeling very hot. Menarche at the age of 12. She has 2 daughters (eutocic births) and completed her desire to have children. Her mother experienced menopause at the age of 41. Blood analysis reveals FSH 65.1 U/L (2-13.8), LH 12 U/L (2-13.8), estradiol < 0.05 pg/mL (follicular phase: 30-100; luteal phase: 50-150; ovulatory peak: 100-400). Two months later, she gets the blood tests redone with similar results. What is the suspected diagnosis and the next steps to take?

options.A: She is probably menopausal, but until 12 months of amenorrhea have passed, she cannot start any treatment.
options.B: Premature ovarian insufficiency. Starts study with karyotype and indicates hormone replacement therapy.
options.C: Premature ovarian failure. It explains that healthy lifestyle habits are essential: no smoking, exercise and adequate intake of vitamin D. It leaves hormone therapy as a second-line treatment.
options.D: Hypothalamic amenorrhea. Requires study with a cranial MRI.

86a1db45-44ff-4aee-b15a-cd6fc8010db5.question: Which of the following vaccines should not be administered to a 9-month-old infant with a combined primary immunodeficiency?:

cf463ec6-f265-41ce-bae7-27959c8abf4d.question: 19-month-old male, correctly vaccinated for his age. Previously well, he suddenly begins a clinical picture with a high fever of up to 40 °C without other symptoms, except irritability. The examination the next day is normal, except for slight hyperemia of oral mucosa and tympanic membrane, and laterocervical microadenopathies. On the fourth day, the fever completely disappears and a morbilliform erythematous rash appears, maculopapular distribution on face, trunk and limbs. Of the following, what is the most likely diagnosis?:

options.C: Roseola, sudden rash or sixth disease.

0814496d-d1a9-4ece-ad60-c55a8fc174cb.question: A 14-month-old infant was brought to the emergency department with a case of irritability over the last 12 hours and bloody, mucusy stools. Examination highlighted episodes of crying, with bending of the lower limbs. On abdominal palpation, a poorly defined cylindrical mass was identified, with the child's crying increasing when pressure was applied to the right side of the abdomen. What is your suspected diagnosis and what test would you perform to confirm it?:

3b4e69e2-21ee-454b-9502-99d70a98d4f4.question: Regarding acute gastroenteritis (AGE) in pediatrics, identify the incorrect statement:

options.A: Rotaviruses are a rare cause of acute gastroenteritis in children worldwide.
options.B: The main bacterial pathogens that cause Gastroenteritis are non-typhoidal Salmonella, Shigella, Campylobacter, and Yersinia.
options.C: Clostridioides difficile disease can be both nosocomial and community-acquired in children.
options.D: Among the bacterial pathogens that cause foodborne diseases are Bacillus cereus, Clostridium perfringens, and Staphylococcus aureus.

a022cd3c-d6ae-4ce6-9c16-14ea9a9048fa.question: Among the following clinical characteristics related to anorexia nervosa, point out the correct statement:

options.A: A clinical form is associated with binge eating and purging behaviors.
options.B: It is distributed equally between both sexes.
options.C: Amenorrhea is a necessary diagnostic criterion for disease in women.
options.D: There is a desire to lose weight, but with a normal perception of one's own constitution.

a2c757a4-08a4-4e81-8c54-3de4c5099a5e.question: In relation to hypertrophic pyloric stenosis, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.B: A higher incidence has been found in daughters of mothers treated with macrolides during pregnancy.
options.C: The typical hydroelectrolytic alteration is a hypochloremic metabolic acidosis.
options.D: The treatment of choice is the Ramstedt extramucosal pyloromyotomy.

4ae73989-5cf7-4405-9ac8-b19c83b324e3.question: For the diagnosis of classic Kawasaki disease, the presence of fever for at least five days and 4 of the main signs of the disease are necessary. Of the following, indicate which IS NOT CONSIDERED a main sign:

options.A: Erythema of the pharyngeal and oral mucosa with strawberry tongue and/or cracked lips.
options.C: Cervical lymphadenopathy (> 1.5 cm in diameter), usually unilateral.

0e46d43d-bb38-4517-a37c-05cda42d2668.question: Regarding vaccines and vaccination schedules in the autonomous communities of Spain, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: Systematic vaccines are those that are mandatorily administered to all children according to the current vaccination schedule in their autonomous community.
options.B: Non-systematic vaccines are those that are not administered universally in all autonomous communities.
options.C: The vaccination schedule is defined as the chronological sequence of vaccines that are systematically administered in a specific country or geographical area.
options.D: Vaccination schedules should be continuously updated according to the development of new vaccines or the change in incidence of diseases in a specific geographic area.

1aab9cfd-5186-4f38-ab21-a2686a22f2b7.question: A 7-year-old patient has been admitted for several days with a diagnosis of pneumonia, treated with antibiotics. He continues to have fever spikes which prompts a thoracic ultrasound, in which pleural effusion with multiple partitions is observed. A diagnostic thoracocentesis is performed, extracting purulent material. What should be done next?:

options.A: Closed drainage with a chest tube with instillation of fibrinolytics.
options.B: Repeated thoracentesis to remove as much effusion as possible.

b58ccd18-3eeb-4b53-98a3-7054fc72df08.question: A 13-year-old female presents to the clinic with high fever of 5 days duration, sore throat, headache, abdominal pain, and severe fatigue that interferes with her daily life. Upon examination, red tonsils with exudative membrane that are foul-smelling are observed. Anterior, posterior, occipital, and epitrochlear lymph nodes are palpable. The liver is palpable at 1 cm and the spleen at 3 cm from the costal margin. Given these symptoms and findings, which serological test would you request?

b20d7eaf-f49a-4838-9488-5fe15e7ef6b0.question: Indicate which drug is not recommended for the maintenance treatment of bipolar disorder:

c9cb8695-fccb-48ac-a0e3-5634b2451678.question: A 26-year-old male has presented with a first depressive episode, with complete remission of symptoms with a first antidepressant in monotherapy. How long is it recommended to maintain the treatment?

options.A: In a first episode in young patients with a good response, treatment can be discontinued after a month.
options.B: It is recommended to maintain the treatment for a minimum of three months after remission.
options.C: It is recommended to continue the treatment for a minimum of six months after remission.
options.D: It is recommended to maintain the treatment for a minimum of two years to prevent relapses.

6517b603-5fe8-405a-9d87-3d931fa56f95.question: A 71-year-old male with no psychiatric history presents with a three-week progression characterized by memory deficit, inattention, insomnia, weight loss, restlessness, morning prevalent distress, and delusional ideas of guilt and harm. Of the following, the most likely diagnosis is:

options.D: Severe depressive episode with psychotic symptoms.

2e50de0b-23b0-4dfc-9890-bd06264f460b.question: Major depression, especially if it is endogenous/melancholic in nature, is characterized by one of the following alterations:

options.C: Difficulty waking up in the morning.

c44098c1-b555-459e-93ca-8045a6fc928e.question: Indicate which of the following disorders is not an anxiety disorder according to the DSM-5:

14d3326d-a50f-4d27-b0c5-0413427ec15b.question: In psychogeriatrics, when the use of benzodiazepines is necessary, which one is the drug of choice?

aa19bd24-cf07-427a-8521-7768924154c4.question: In relation to the side effects of antipsychotics, point out the incorrect statement:

options.A: The occurrence of metabolic syndrome is more common with the use of typical antipsychotics.
options.B: Sedation is a common side effect with most antipsychotics, more pronounced at the beginning of treatment.
options.C: Tardive dyskinesia is an involuntary movement disorder that most frequently affects the orofacial region, appears after prolonged administration of antipsychotics and may be irreversible.
options.D: Akathisia is an extrapyramidal side effect for which the addition of benzodiazepines or the use of beta blockers may be indicated for treatment.

1595f9c4-6d42-4445-ad04-5f0dc8fa9a2f.question: Regarding combined therapy with psychotropic drugs and psychotherapy for mental disorders, it is true that:

options.A: It is only indicated when both forms of treatment have failed separately.
options.B: The quick relief of anxiety symptoms due to medication reduces the motivation for psychotherapy.
options.C: It requires that the same professional carry out both treatment modalities.
options.D: The results of combined therapy are superior to those of each one used separately.

29d28870-1a73-4fd6-af3a-639d04565a37.question: Within the primary parkinsonian syndromes, Parkinson's disease is caused by:

options.A: A neuronal degeneration that particularly affects the globus pallidus, reticular substance, and inferior olive, resulting in a dopamine deficit.
options.B: A degeneration of the nuclei of the pons, inferior olive, and the cerebellum.
options.C: A cellular degeneration in the substantia nigra reduces the dopamine rate at the striatum level, which causes excessive subthalamic and pallidal activity.
options.D: A progressive neuronal degeneration at the cortical level and in the basal ganglia.

57721860-824c-4c27-aee2-a20c552c1f6e.question: Regarding the neurological examination of a lesion in the corticospinal tract, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: Global weakness is found in all muscle groups of the affected limbs.
options.C: Displays hypertonia of the rigidity type.
options.D: There is hyperreflexia in the patellar tendon reflexes.

175809e0-fc18-422f-8329-057f0d8af598.question: A 52-year-old male, diabetic, who is consulting for painless right foot drop. On examination, there is weakness in the anterior tibial muscle and right peroneals, with preserved patellar and achilles reflexes. What is the most likely diagnosis?

7d870be4-fec6-473a-8e3f-0f7dc36c7f3b.question: In a patient with a parkinsonian syndrome that has evolved over two years, indicate which of the following clinical manifestations would make you doubt a diagnosis of Parkinson's disease:

options.C: Presence of a REM sleep behavior disorder.

4e268f2a-88c0-45f6-8333-e93aac55d19d.question: A 19-year-old student suffers a first generalized tonic-clonic seizure while lying on the couch. The neurological examination is normal. In the directed anamnesis, he tells us that he had been sleeping fewer hours these days because he was studying for exams and that sometimes, in the mornings, he has arm spasms when grabbing the breakfast cup. His electroencephalogram shows generalized spike and polyspike-wave discharges. Indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: The cranial MRI is probably normal.
options.B: I would not start treatment as this is a first crisis.
options.C: The most likely diagnosis is juvenile myoclonic epilepsy.

9d9492e2-804d-4c7f-b8c2-cd357b57fd28.question: A 21-year-old male presents with a psychiatric condition characterized by hallucinations, behavioral changes, and episodes of catatonia. Within a few days, memory deficit and oral dyskinesias are added to the condition and on the tenth day, he starts having seizures. Which of the following tests would provide more information for the diagnosis?

options.C: Perform a treatment cycle with high-dose methylprednisolone to evaluate response.
options.D: Study of specific autoimmune autoantibodies in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) and serum.

d6a63aba-7442-4050-88d5-b975bbb181f7.question: A 53-year-old woman with no significant history presents to the emergency department with sudden onset speech disturbance one hour ago. On evaluation, only motor aphasia is detected. The baseline cranial CT is normal. However, the perfusion CT shows a flow defect in the left frontal cortical region with no involvement in the volume maps. Furthermore, the angio-CT shows a thrombus in the distal segment (M3-M4) of the left middle cerebral artery. Identify which of the following is the most appropriate treatment:

options.C: Endovenous fibrinolysis and, if recanalization is not achieved, mechanical thrombectomy.

89c5999d-1ad4-4723-aa23-50d7872771df.question: In patients with tuberous sclerosis (Bourneville's disease), indicate the incorrect response:

options.B: They usually present with facial angiofibromas.
options.C: The most common brain tumor is the subependymal giant cell astrocytoma.

e2a57906-cda2-46d7-86c3-51d8a77025a2.question: A 64-year-old woman presents with facial pain in the territory of the third branch of the V pair. Regarding the diagnosis of trigeminal neuralgia, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.B: The pain has a trigger point, associated with tactile stimulation of the affected area.
options.C: The pain can disappear spontaneously after persisting for weeks or months.
options.D: It is associated with facial hypoesthesia.

e07f595e-83b9-4224-8edc-6002abe79485.question: Regarding post-traumatic epileptic seizures, it is true that:

options.A: They are common immediately after the impact.
options.B: Penetrating injuries and the severity of the injury are contributing factors.
options.D: After a couple of years of higher risk, patients with severe injuries have the same risk as the general population.

098b7107-0378-4755-8789-6f3441152867.question: A 25-year-old male is admitted to the ICU after an undetermined pharmacological intoxication. Due to a progressive decrease in the level of consciousness, with no improvement with naloxone or flumazenil, it was decided to perform orotracheal intubation and invasive mechanical ventilation. Which of the following drugs would not be used to perform the orotracheal intubation?:

63cc99f7-1342-42d4-af63-6697fb29725f.question: A 50-year-old male with Legionella pneumonia requiring admission to the ICU due to acute respiratory failure. He needs to be intubated orotracheally and connected to invasive mechanical ventilation. He is diagnosed with acute respiratory distress syndrome and is placed in the prone position. With respect to this positional technique, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: It is performed to try to increase the relationship between the partial pressure of oxygen and the inspired fraction of oxygen.
options.B: It is performed by trained personnel to avoid complications.
options.C: The relationship between the partial pressure of oxygen and the inspired fraction of oxygen below which is recommended is 300 mmHg.
options.D: The prone position during invasive mechanical ventilation requires deep sedation.

ead4618e-3997-460b-b56c-b8a21b038c08.question: A 58-year-old patient suffering from pneumonia due to COVID-19 requiring intubation with mechanical ventilation in ICU. After a week, a tracheostomy is performed, and the patient continues to require mechanical ventilation. A motor deficit is detected in all four limbs with general hypo-reflexivity. The initial diagnostic orientation and the therapeutic approach to follow will be:

options.A: Guillain-Barré Syndrome. Confirm the diagnosis with additional tests.
options.C: Critical Illness Myopathy. Steroids and supplementary tests.
options.D: Critical illness myopathy. Intensive respiratory and motor rehabilitation.

1d907296-c789-42c2-8724-50b479ae28a2.question: A 55-year-old man with no significant medical history, who after exertion, experiences lumbar pain radiating to the lower right limb, anterior and lateral part of the thigh, and front of the knee. Examination: positive Lasègue sign at 40 º, decreased patellar reflex, and difficulty in heel to toe walking. What is the most likely diagnosis?

4d09b440-f22b-4cf0-93da-9345bc9ba88f.question: A 5-year-old patient comes to emergency with a fever that has lasted for 48 hours, responding poorly to antipyretics and refusing to support on the left lower limb. In the physical examination, limited mobility of the hip is observed. Analysis shows an increase in CRP and leukocytosis. What supplemental test should be the first to be requested?:

2167c477-49a6-40c5-9b90-3acac9f8ffad.question: 82-year-old woman with a history of congestive heart failure and breast cancer who is consulting for a left wrist fracture. The fracture is stable, not comminuted, and does not have intra-articular traces. Which of the following treatments is most appropriate?:

options.C: Osteosynthesis with dorsal and volar plates.

a7814c10-bc05-4efa-ad08-f7af5ec0f388.question: A 35-year-old domestic worker, with no relevant medical history, right-handed, who reports pain in the 5th finger of her left hand and the inner side of her left forearm accompanied by numbness and partial loss of sensitivity. What would be the first diagnostic suspicion?

6c32aaca-3378-4fb4-87bb-d0804761f0d0.question: Regarding the nonunion of the scaphoid, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: It usually progresses with necrosis of the distal fragment of the fracture.
options.B: It can progress in an asymptomatic manner.
options.C: In the long term, it usually causes radiocarpal osteoarthritis.
options.D: In early stages, the treatment of choice is the fixation of the fracture and provision of a bone graft.

a623bf67-6c99-4caf-a554-4a503c369634.question: 69-year-old male with a body mass index of 37 and significant central (abdominal) obesity, suffering from incapacitating lumbar pain that extends to both buttock regions, but does not radiate to the lower limbs. It prevents him from standing still and walking for more than 10 minutes, but disappears when sitting and in bed. The Lasègue maneuver is negative. What is the most probable diagnosis?

options.A: Disc herniation at the L5-S1 level.

323c77db-4107-4611-89ff-7ba550d54fdc.question: In the case of a diaphyseal lesion of the humerus of lytic character that affects the entire diameter of the bone in a 67-year-old male with a history of lung cancer (estimated survival greater than 2 years) and causing him poorly controlled continuous pain. Which of the following is the best therapeutic approach?:

options.A: Observant approach, as this is a non-weight bearing bone, which reduces the risk of fracture.
options.B: Application of high-dose morphine to control pain that allows him to undergo physiotherapy to recover function.
options.C: Adjust a cast correctly to reduce the risk of fracture.
options.D: Placement of a locked intramedullary nail.

788786da-399d-47ce-8634-a87c1084feb6.question: A 29-year-old male presents with lumbar pain and hand edema of several weeks duration, along with blurred vision and red eyes. He has had multiple unprotected sexual encounters and there are cases of psoriasis in his family. On physical examination, he presents with a temperature of 37.5 ºC, bilateral conjunctival injection, and swelling of the distal parts of the fingers and left wrist, with positive sacroiliac maneuvers. What is the most likely diagnosis?

52cb51a6-b276-48b1-87ea-ff2aa6e8a97a.question: A 55-year-old male with a history of hyperuricemia presents to the emergency department with a first episode of very intense and disabling acute pain in the right knee accompanied by redness, swelling and edema. Low-grade fever of 37.5ºC. What is the most advisable course of action to follow?:

options.A: Perform arthrocentesis and send the synovial fluid to the laboratory to evaluate the presence of crystals and germs.
options.B: Start treatment with colchicine because you are experiencing a gout episode.
options.C: Start treatment with an NSAID and allopurinol to treat the gout episode and hyperuricemia.
options.D: Start treatment with an NSAID, allopurinol and an antibiotic to treat the gout episode, hyperuricemia, and probable infection.

6b12595a-6f02-4bfa-8056-76d0438df91c.question: An 81-year-old asthmatic woman who frequently uses corticosteroids to control bronchospasm outbreaks is seeking help because she has intense acute pain in the dorsolumbar region after falling at home from a chair. What is the most advisable course of action to follow?:

options.A: Urgently request dorsal and lumbar spine x-rays and prescribe analgesic treatment for the pain.
options.B: Request a thoracic and lumbar MRI and schedule analgesic treatment and rest for the pain.
options.C: Prescribe analgesic treatment and start antiresorptive therapy.
options.D: Request a densitometry, schedule analgesic treatment and start with antiresorptive treatment, calcium and vitamin D.

595011e9-e2a4-44ed-902a-fb908cc34129.question: Which of the following is not a criterion for the diagnosis of infectious endocarditis?:

options.A: Presence of major arterial embolic phenomena.
options.B: A single positive blood culture for Coxiella burnetii.
options.C: At least two positive blood cultures drawn with an interval > 12 hours of microorganisms compatible with an infectious endocarditis.

08f9d608-ab03-4675-8b28-01f9504672ae.question: Which of the following criteria is considered high risk in the stratification of syncope?

options.A: Syncope produced when turning the head or pressing the carotid sinus.
options.B: Syncope during exertion or while lying supine.
options.C: Syncope after an unpleasant sight, sound, or smell.
options.D: Second degree Mobitz I atrioventricular block.

8453b1a1-5523-4aef-beed-aa46fa76f7dd.question: Indicate which of the following tachycardias cannot be explained by a re-entry mechanism:

options.B: Polymorphic ventricular tachycardia type torsade de pointes.
options.C: Reciprocal atrioventricular tachycardia in Wolff-Parkinson-White syndrome.
options.D: Tachycardia associated with defects in the interatrial septum.

c6a8ee5a-6778-4d38-88cb-41eb273087ef.question: A 68-year-old male with a mechanical mitral valve, anticoagulated with acenocoumarol, presents with an INR of 9 in a routine check-up at his health center. He has no symptoms of bleeding at the current moment. Which of the following is the most correct approach?:

options.A: Discontinue treatment with acenocoumarol and administer 10 mg of vitamin K in slow intravenous infusion, which should be repeated every 12 hours if necessary.
options.B: Discontinue the acenocoumarol and refer the patient to a hospital center to monitor the onset of bleeding.
options.C: Temporarily suspend the acenocoumarol and resume anticoagulation when the therapeutic range has been achieved, recalculating the dose.
options.D: Begin the administration of prothrombin complex concentrate or fresh frozen plasma according to weight.

15bd3666-3392-466c-a24b-36e6801c7926.question: Regarding cardiac tamponade, which of the following statements is true?:

options.A: The echocardiographic manifestations and hemodynamic changes occur prior to the appearance of clinical manifestations.
options.B: Typical symptoms include low blood pressure, tachycardia, decreased jugular venous pressure, and diminished heart sounds.
options.C: The volume of pericardial fluid required to produce tamponade is similar in acute pericarditis as in chronic pericarditis.
options.D: The paradoxical pulse is a characteristic finding of the physical examination, defined as a decrease of 5-10 mmHg in systolic blood pressure during inspiration.

d2cc7dce-97e2-49f2-a721-3f0148416a6a.question: A 71-year-old patient, diabetic, with no other comorbidities, previously diagnosed with severe aortic stenosis. He was admitted for an acute coronary syndrome without ST elevation, Killip I with a slightly elevated peak in troponin. The catheterization shows coronary disease with significant proximal lesions of the three coronary vessels. His ventricular function is normal. Which of the following therapeutic strategies is the most correct?:

options.A: Interventional treatment with the implantation of coronary stents in all 3 vessels and simultaneous implantation of a transcatheter aortic bioprosthesis (TAVI).
options.B: Surgical mechanical aortic valve prosthesis, followed by interventional percutaneous coronary treatment at a later stage.
options.C: Transcatheter aortic biological prosthesis (TAVI) and then, on an outpatient basis, percutaneously treat the coronary arteries with stents.
options.D: Simultaneous surgical treatment with valve replacement and coronary surgical revascularization with bypass.

3f73364b-7657-4b5a-8f4b-dcffb4841f92.question: A 75-year-old male who reports progressive dyspnea, with decreasing tolerance for effort. He reports fainting on two occasions in recent months, coinciding with moderate effort and reports occasional chest pain that increases with effort. On examination, the presence of a parvus et tardus arterial pulse and a mesosystolic murmur are notable. The analysis is normal except for a creatinine of 2.2 mg/dL. The surgical risk assessment establishes an intermediate risk. Please indicate which of the following therapeutic options is most recommended:

options.A: Surgical replacement of the mitral valve.
options.B: Percutaneous implantation of the aortic valve (TAVI).
options.C: Surgical replacement of the aortic valve.

7189f568-c27b-4a89-a206-b8d56a8e426d.question: A 43-year-old woman, professional swimmer, with no relevant medical history, reports swelling and heaviness in her right arm for 72 hours. Upon examination, edema of the right upper limb is noticeable with the presence of dilated veins in the pectoral region. Regarding the diagnostic approach, indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: The color Doppler ultrasound is of great value as the first diagnostic test.
options.B: A simple chest x-ray should be performed to detect bone abnormalities.
options.C: The angiogram-CT allows for confirmatory diagnosis.
options.D: A phlebography should be performed to confirm the presence of axillosubclavian venous thrombosis.

ddb6048e-862c-4f46-abeb-43c596dbfd89.question: A 72-year-old male presents to the emergency department with fever, cough, and purulent expectoration for the past three days. Upon examination, he is oriented and has a good level of consciousness. Blood pressure is 110/75 mmHg, respiratory rate is 32 breaths/min. Pulmonary auscultation reveals crackles in the middle field of the right hemithorax. The chest X-ray shows an alveolar infiltrate in the middle lobe. Point out the correct statement about the severity criteria gathered in the CRB-65 scale and the attitude to follow:

options.A: Score of 0 points and would be subject to discharge and outpatient treatment.
options.B: Score of 1 point and would be eligible for discharge and outpatient treatment depending on the doctor's judgement.
options.C: Score of 2 points and may require hospital admission depending on the doctor's discretion.
options.D: Score of 3 points and requires hospital admission.

0065e38a-2da4-40cc-be68-1e00d4968c56.question: A 67-year-old male diagnosed with COPD with a GOLD 1 category, smoker, who reports dyspnea with intense efforts, without exacerbations. Which of the following would be the most correct therapeutic recommendation?:

options.A: Regular treatment with long-acting muscarinic bronchodilators (LAMA).
options.B: Regular treatment with long-acting beta-adrenergic bronchodilators (LABA).
options.C: Treatment with LABA plus inhaled glucocorticoids.

8184f4a6-1b3b-4a61-ac1c-3ea5c8b69b91.question: 70-year-old woman admitted for severe traumatic brain injury with secondary subarachnoid hemorrhage. On the second day of admission, she presents with dyspnea and chest pain. A chest angio-CT scan is performed which confirms the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism. The treatment of choice is:

9e4dd04f-069a-48d1-8df7-30c30519e51b.question: A 71-year-old patient presents with jaundice with a total bilirubin of 6 mg/dL (direct bilirubin 4 mg/dL), normal transaminases and elevated GGT of 349 U/L and alkaline phosphatase of 260 U/L. An abdominal ultrasound shows dilation of the intra- and extrahepatic bile ducts. The patient does not have pain but reports a weight loss of about 5 kg in the last month. An endoscopic retrograde cholangiopancreatography was performed, revealing an abrupt stenosis of the distal bile duct. What is your first diagnostic suspicion?

67b1854f-588d-40f2-bf87-fe80ae3f099c.question: A 58-year-old male with compensated cirrhosis Child A-5 secondary to non-alcoholic fatty liver, with no other history. He reports asthenia without anorexia or weight loss. In a screening abdominal ultrasound and subsequently in a triphasic thoracoabdominal CT, four liver lesions (one of them 6 cm) are detected, hypervascular in the arterial phase and with washout in the venous phase, with portal vein invasion and without extrahepatic metastases. No ascites is observed. Which of the following is the best treatment?:

e8a02108-c5af-41c6-8a3f-10b0cad89a97.question: Which of the following types of acute appendicitis most frequently presents with a positive psoas sign?:

0b8ac6e2-5436-4d2f-aa98-3ed534031a08.question: A 45-year-old patient had an episode of cholecystitis three months ago, in which gallstones were discovered by ultrasound. Now the patient presents with high alkaline phosphatase and in a new ultrasound, small size gallstones with a bile duct of 1 cm in diameter. Which of the following examinations would you perform before the surgical intervention?

66449219-7daf-4c9a-96dd-2860da0290c1.question: Regarding the anal fissure, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: It consists of a longitudinal tear in the skin that covers the portion of the anal canal distal to the dentate line, causing intense pain during defecation.
options.B: It has two typical forms: the primary or idiopathic appears in healthy individuals and is not associated with any type of disease; the secondary is detected in patients who are suffering from another process.
options.C: Most primary fissures are located in the anterior commissure, as this is an area of the anal canal more susceptible to trauma and mucosal ischemia.
options.D: Fissures secondary to other diseases often appear in more lateral positions.

64e3f911-cd11-4c66-8dd9-050a0db1f8c3.question: A 24-year-old woman underwent endometriosis surgery a year ago due to episodes of intense abdominal pain, particularly related to her menstrual cycle, occasionally accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Despite the surgery, she has not noticed any improvement, with progressive worsening and spreading of the pain throughout her body, along with limb weakness. Routine tests are normal, antinuclear antibodies and rheumatoid factor are negative, there are only some isolated results with a Na of 132 mEq/L and some slightly elevated ALT (GOT). Recent abdominal ultrasound and abdominopelvic CT scan are normal. Two months ago, she was diagnosed with depression and fibromyalgia. Antidepressant treatment and opiate-derived analgesics appear to have no effect. She has spent months hardly getting out of bed. We are asked for a second opinion. Indicate which of the following diagnostic tests we should check has been performed:

options.B: Porphobilinogen and aminolevulinic acid in urine.

9b6241a1-a191-479d-9a55-c5034b689d1e.question: A 34-year-old male, who goes to the emergency room due to dyspnea evolved over three weeks, along with the presence of intermittent red urine over the last ten days. The physical examination reveals: temperature 36.6 ºC, BP 132/72 mmHg, respiratory rate 16 rpm and heart rate 88 bpm, along with dispersed fine rales in pulmonary auscultation. Blood analysis: BUN 56 mg/dL, creatinine 5.8 mg/dL. Urine analysis: red cells 4+, proteins 2+. A kidney biopsy is performed, revealing a diffuse glomerulonephritis with crescent formations. Which of the following tests would confirm the diagnosis?:

options.B: Titers of anti-glomerular basement membrane antibodies.
options.D: Stool culture for Escherichia coli O157:H7.

faf86b41-1e10-490b-946e-955bdc0f1bd4.question: A 36-year-old patient arrives at the emergency department due to general malaise. No previous analytical tests exist. Creatinine 10 mg/dL, Hb 6.5 g/L, absence of microalbuminuria, PTH 500 pg/ml, total diuresis preserved are detected. Ultrasound: kidneys are reduced in size. Which of the following diagnoses is most likely?:

c0b5e935-1e52-4156-88d3-45f058d8113a.question: English translation: A 73-year-old man presents to the emergency department with pain in the lumbosacral area radiating to both flanks and hypogastrium, of two-week's duration, that does not alleviate with high doses of ibuprofen.
