718a03dc-65d0-41c4-a1b8-4c7060dffd20.question: In relation to celiac disease, indicate the correct answer:

options.A: Confirmation with an intestinal biopsy is necessary for a definitive diagnosis.
options.B: The genetics (DQ2/DQ8) have a high negative predictive value.
options.C: People with Prader-Willi syndrome are at a higher risk of developing celiac disease than the general population.
options.D: It is common to develop gluten tolerance with age.

4af8cc5f-84ff-46c7-b09f-debfd6b9c302.question: In the treatment of acute diarrhea in a child, only one of the proposed measures is correct, please indicate it:

options.A: An astringent diet low in fiber should be recommended until it is resolved.
options.B: It is recommended to initially reduce the intake of lactose during the first few days of diarrhea.
options.C: Oral rehydration should be proposed for 4-6 hours and subsequent refeeding with a normal diet.
options.D: The presence of Salmonella in the stool should be treated with antibiotics to prevent its spread.

4b779241-4558-45ed-84c5-bf01ea07c326.question: In the refeeding syndrome at the start of treatment for chronic malnutrition, all of the following analytical alterations may appear, except one. Indicate which one:

4397af86-137b-41e1-bc7c-e67fa3ccd52d.question: A patient with moderate Alzheimer's disease who presents episodes of severe agitation and aggression along with psychotic symptoms can be treated with one of the following drugs, which is approved for this indication. Indicate which:

2d6b9f9a-a9c0-421b-ba10-00ec246789c2.question: A 79-year-old patient is brought to the Emergency Department at 7 pm from a residence, but we do not have the referral report and therefore do not know his medical history. He is disoriented in time and space. He has trouble remembering simple information. Sometimes he becomes very nervous and agitated, because he sees threatening people, even when he is alone. At other times he appears drowsy and inattentive. The main evidence supporting the diagnosis of delirium rather than dementia is:

options.D: The fluctuation of the alert level.

21194dfa-af31-4ce5-b9f3-3e71b46b66da.question: Indicate which is not an indication for electroconvulsive therapy:

options.A: Severe major depressive disorder in the elderly.
options.C: Severe and disabling agoraphobia in young people.
options.D: Acute forms of schizophrenia in young people.

b7d68c0c-5805-4b8f-8afd-cadfa7655b11.question: In the case of a sudden onset of obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) in a 9-year-old child who also presents with tics and chorea as neurological manifestations, an infection by: should be ruled out.

e7d8c653-54cb-4a9c-884c-66400688100b.question: What is the mechanism of action of the antidepressant bupropion?

options.A: Inhibits the reuptake of norepinephrine and serotonin.
options.B: Inhibits the reuptake of noradrenaline and dopamine.
options.C: It is a dopamine antagonist and inhibits the reuptake of serotonin.
options.D: It is a glutamate antagonist and inhibits the reuptake of dopamine.

c5c8f539-f4db-4035-a1fa-f540d52a5bb4.question: A 46-year-old man with bipolar disorder is rushed to the emergency room after an overdose of lithium carbonate. On examination, there is intense tremor, ataxia, dysarthria, myoclonus, and fasciculations. His lithium level is 4.1 mEq/L (toxicity > 1.6 mEq/L). Which of the following therapeutic options would be most appropriate?:

b36c8f36-a642-45e2-b14d-ca58abbe6489.question: Among the interactions of antipsychotics with other pharmacological groups, indicate which of the following is false:

options.A: Smokers usually have higher levels of antipsychotics in their plasma than non-smokers.
options.B: Lithium can worsen extrapyramidal symptoms and increase neurotoxicity.
options.C: Carbamazepine decreases the plasma levels of antipsychotics.
options.D: Antidepressants increase plasma levels of antipsychotics.

1f22e4fe-ff70-46be-a893-36b9c5bb2065.question: An 11-year-old and 6-month-old premenarchal girl, with known idiopathic scoliosis. The spine radiograph taken 6 months ago showed a left thoraco-lumbar curve of 18° (Cobb angle). In the current one, a Cobb angle of 28° is observed, with an iliac crest maturation (Risser sign) of 2. At this developmental stage, what is the most appropriate treatment to try to stop the curve's progression?

options.D: The surgical intervention through spinal fusion.

5c1ef9b6-b4f4-4e83-b329-9da31b197b98.question: A woman is having difficulty walking after gynecological surgery. She experiences mild pain in the thigh and her leg gives out when she puts weight on it. Upon examination, she shows weakness when flexing the hip and extending the knee, and has dysesthesia in the front of the thigh. What is the most probable suspected diagnosis?

options.B: Meralgia paresthetica of the femoral cutaneous nerve.

d1ab625f-c525-4234-b8a1-028d96aed43d.question: A 58-year-old hypertensive man goes to the emergency room for a 30-second fainting episode while running, with spontaneous recovery and no sequelae. Blood pressure is 135/65 mmHg. Cardiac auscultation presents a rough, intense systolic murmur, which is reduced with Valsalva maneuvers and a muted second sound. The ECG shows a sinus rhythm at 72 bpm, with criteria for left ventricular hypertrophy and inverted T waves on the anterior face. Indicate the correct statement:

options.A: The clinical picture suggests a pulmonary embolism.
options.B: The provided data indicates hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with severe obstruction of the left ventricle outflow tract.
options.C: These data correspond to severe aortic stenosis.
options.D: An aortic dissection should be ruled out using a contrast-enhanced computed tomography scan.

257595e3-0b97-4f71-9e5b-a927b848e484.question: Among the following combinations of drugs, which one has shown a reduction in mortality in heart failure with reduced ejection fraction?:

options.A: Beta blockers and angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors.
options.C: Loop diuretics and calcium channel antagonists.
options.D: Angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitors and calcium channel antagonists.

4bf2b7ce-8031-431f-a175-b709f6eab488.question: An 83-year-old woman with a beta-lactam allergy was admitted due to acute pyelonephritis and vomiting. She has been taking amiodarone for 3 years for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation. Upon admission, levofloxacin and metoclopramide are prescribed. Haloperidol is added due to nocturnal agitation. On the 6th day, she suffers a syncope from which she recovers within a few seconds. The ECG shows a sinus rhythm at 50 bpm, narrow QRS and QTc 510 ms. In this clinical context, what etiology would explain the syncope?

c81b4490-835c-4272-9446-f1ed6dd6d3e8.question: Regarding a patient with acute pericarditis and severe pericardial effusion, which of the following measures is incorrect?:

options.A: Admission for close monitoring of the onset of signs of tamponade.
options.B: Administration of diuretics that facilitate the disappearance of the effusion.

9e9c2e8b-e0c1-4e31-b245-46552eca9ac2.question: 42-year-old man with a history of compensated liver cirrhosis, brought to the emergency room for jaundice, fever, increased abdominal girth, and significant general status deterioration. Which of the following analytical parameters would not provide information about the prognosis?:

90809989-8b00-4d8d-8c91-043db1d47db2.question: A 55-year-old man was referred for consultation following the detection of hypertransaminasemia and hepatic steatosis during a health examination. He has hypothyroidism and is undergoing replacement therapy, along with well-controlled diabetes managed with metformin. He consumes alcohol very occasionally. Physical examination revealed Type I obesity (body mass index, BMI 33 kg/m2). The lab analysis indicated: aspartate aminotransferase (AST) 87 UI/L, alanine aminotransferase (ALT) 65 UI/L, gamma-glutamyltransferase (GGT) 100 UI/L, total cholesterol 230 mg/dL, and fasting blood glucose level 132 mg/dl. Bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, thyroid hormones, and ferritin were all normal. Coagulation was also normal. Virological hepatitis serology (HAV, HBV, and HCV) and autoimmunity (ANA, AMA, AML, antiLKM) were both negative. Indicate the most appropriate statement:

options.A: You have hepatic steatosis without the risk of developing cirrhosis or hepatocellular carcinoma, hence periodic metabolic control is sufficient.
options.B: It is indicated to perform a liver biopsy due to the suspicion of autoimmune hepatitis.
options.C: It is useful to perform a transition elastography (FibroScan ®) to determine the existence or absence of fibrosis.
options.D: It is recommended to replace metformin with pioglitazone, which has proven to be more effective in improving hepatic steatosis.

31b86c9f-dabf-4d1a-b00e-1f1721b7705a.question: Patient with stage B Child hepatic cirrhosis with ascites and history of spontaneous bacterial peritonitis (SBP). Which of the following antibiotic treatment guidelines is considered appropriate as prophylaxis for SBP?:

3136e729-9543-4b29-90dc-be7aff5660c0.question: Young patient with inflammatory bowel disease diagnosed with ankylosing spondylitis. Which of the following statements is false?:

options.A: Ankylosing spondylitis is more common in patients with Crohn's disease.
options.B: The activity of ankylosing spondylitis is related to the inflammatory activity of inflammatory bowel disease.
options.C: The activity of ankylosing spondylitis does not subside with glucocorticoids.
options.D: The progression of ankylosing spondylitis is slow and progressive.

370e2fb2-8d02-4c59-9859-b719f0b2c403.question: The medical treatment of macroprolactinomas should reduce the tumor mass, normalize serum prolactin levels, and restore gonadal function. This can be achieved with:

options.B: Selective agonists of D2 dopaminergic receptors.
options.D: Antagonists of the V2 receptors of desmopressin.

d2d73a47-f6d4-4a69-8eb4-683796d5045b.question: Postabsorptive hypoglycemia caused by non-insulinoma tumors is characterized by:

options.A: As it is common in small-sized abdominal tumors with rapid growth.
options.B: Because plasma levels of proinsulin, insulin and C-peptide are suppressed during hypoglycemia.
options.C: Because the levels of IGFI are characteristically elevated and the IGFII/IGFI ratio is abnormally low.
options.D: Because tumoral hypoglycemia is one of the most frequent complications in hematological neoplasms in the absence of cachexia.

67c89319-579c-4a6d-a631-4a47343660f1.question: Oral administration of urea results in increased diuresis and decreased natriuresis, thus constituting a safe and effective treatment for:

options.A: Hypotonic hyponatremia in a situation of euvolemia.
options.B: Hypotonic hyponatremia in a hypovolemic situation.

options.A: It is caused by mutations of aquaporin-
options.B: 2. It is due to a marked reduction in the levels of aquaporin-2.
options.C: Responds to low doses of desmopressin.
options.D: Thiazide diuretics and amiloride are contraindicated in their treatment.

d3f359aa-65e4-4bfb-9f03-60e3fc13e94b.question: A 67-year-old patient who, in the last 6 months, in two routine laboratories, presents progressive lymphocytosis. In the last one, hemoglobin 15.4 g/dl; leukocytes 18.5 x10³/µL with 82% of mature lymphocytes that express the CD5/CD19/CD23 antigens by flow cytometry and platelets 240 x10³/µL. What seems to be the appropriate approach?

options.A: Study of TP53 mutations to establish prognosis.
options.B: Bone aspiration/biopsy to confirm the diagnosis.
options.C: PET/CT to establish the therapeutic approach.
options.D: New clinical and analytical control in 6 months.

fa52c967-f1a6-4285-8607-919914cb0a2c.question: A 65-year-old woman was sent to emergencies due to fever and alterations in her blood test: Hemoglobin 11.4 g/dL, leukocytes 0.86 x10³/µL, (neutrophils 41.9%, lymphocytes 55.8%), platelets 48.0 x10³/µL, fibrinogen 118 mg/dL, D-dimer 20.2 µg/mL. Bone marrow examination was carried out, from which she was diagnosed with acute leukemia with t(15;17) in 60% of the cells. Which of the following responses is correct?

options.A: If she is asymptomatic, trans retinoic acid (ATRA) will be initiated and day hospital checks will be recommended.
options.B: Treatment will be initiated with arsenic trioxide, ATRA and supportive therapy.
options.C: It is a type M3 myeloblastic leukemia, so chemotherapy treatment and heparin will be initiated to control disseminated intravascular coagulation.
options.D: Antibiotic treatment should be started. Once the fever has subsided, leukemia treatment will be initiated.

850e9eeb-f310-48c1-a67b-9fc4ce8edb4f.question: An 18-year-old patient goes to the emergency room with a several days old nosebleed, with no relevant personal or family history. On examination, the patient is afebrile, multiple bruising is observed, no splenomegaly is palpated. Blood tests show: Leukocytes 7.2 x10³/µL, Hb 12.3 g/dL, Platelets 6.0 x10³/µL. Thrombocytopenia is confirmed in the smear, where enlarged platelets are observed. Coagulation study and biochemistry are normal. What is the most probable diagnosis?

d4f59847-2af0-43ba-a034-ab0361076bd0.question: In relation to follicular lymphoma, point out the incorrect one:

options.A: It is the second most common lymphoma in the West.
options.B: The neoplastic cells are derived from a lymphocyte of the bone marrow.
options.C: It can transform into a diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.
options.D: It can remain for years without needing treatment.

b568f94d-d5ac-45f0-a148-b595da244564.question: Regarding Listeria monocytogenes, indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: It is a gram-positive bacillus, catalase positive.
options.B: It is widely distributed in soil, wastewater, and decomposing vegetation.
options.C: Humans and animals can be asymptomatic carriers.
options.D: The treatment of choice for meningitis caused by L. monocytogenes is a cephalosporin.

2e2685aa-eea1-4cf4-ba44-a72206d6bfaf.question: A 54-year-old man who is seeking consultation for urination symptoms consistent with prostatic pathology. I-PSS=22+4, residual urine volume 120 cc, maximum flow 7.2 ml/s, PSA=0.91 ng/ml, and prostatic volume in ultrasound 31 cc. His first therapeutic recommendation will be:

6b38d2b5-c763-42cf-a467-7d3cb2b8ac99.question: A 37-year-old woman with no other significant history than an appendectomy. She shows up at the emergency department with right kidney-area pain that has been ongoing for 3 days and a fever of 39°C. Her blood work shows leucocytosis (14 x10³/µL with neutrophilia) and a C-reactive protein level of 15 mg/dL. Her urinalysis shows microscopic hematuria, significant leucocyturia and pyuria. She is admitted with a diagnosis of acute pyelonephritis and intravenous ceftriaxone antibiotic treatment is started. Three days later, she still has a fever of 38.5°C, increased leucocytosis, and deteriorating renal function. Considering the diagnostic suspicion, what test would you request next?

options.A: Computed axial tomography with intravenous contrast.

ac5122bf-2800-4ad7-a9ea-1cc4d050556c.question: 59-year-old man with diabetic nephropathy, with an estimated glomerular filtration rate of 36 ml/min/1.73 m2 and an albuminuria/creatininuria index of 350 mg/g. According to the KDIGO 2012 chronic kidney disease classification, this corresponds to the category:

35678ccf-0c2c-4fe7-8be6-262c5fc6815c.question: In relation to membranous nephropathy, indicate the false answer:

options.A: The majority of membranous nephropathies are of idiopathic cause.
options.B: What best predicts the prognosis is the presence of interstitial involvement and not glomerular damage (stages I to IV).
options.C: Antibodies against the phospholipase A2 receptor (Anti-PLA2R) are usually positive in idiopathic forms.
options.D: 90% of patients achieve remission with corticosteroids only.

c0977823-df76-4538-8cf9-fb1247570c8b.question: In which of the following situations can a metabolic acidosis without an elevated anion gap occur?:

de833ae5-f5eb-4056-ba7c-1f4744c02fc9.question: A 27-year-old woman with a non-productive cough, fever and pleuritic pain that has developed over a month. The chest X-ray reveals a left pleural effusion. The pleural fluid analysis shows a lymphocytic exudate with a pH of 7.32, glucose 66 mg/dL and adenosine-deaminase 59 U/L. What is the most likely etiology?

a088c0a9-c82c-449a-a718-8fd23ffdf235.question: In a subject over 65 years old, a tuberculin test has shown an induration of 3 mm. The induration in a second test, performed 10 days later, is 13 mm. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The first reaction is a false positive.
options.B: The second reaction is a true positive.
options.C: The first reaction is a true negative.
options.D: The second reaction is a false positive.

520f8d93-bd52-4ad6-b505-3b306d990dcc.question: Which of the following alternatives to total lung lavage is not appropriate in the treatment of autoimmune alveolar proteinosis?:

8172021f-9ea7-44ce-87a4-efe3b289d272.question: 72-year-old man with a history of COPD with severe airway obstruction, with two severe exacerbations in the last year, comes to the emergency room with tachypnea and use of accessory muscles. He is alert. The basal arterial blood gas shows: pH 7.29, PaCO2 68 mmHg, PaO2 51 mmHg. Bronchodilator treatment, steroids, empirical antibiotic therapy are started and oxygen therapy is adjusted to achieve a SatO2 between 88 and 92%. After an hour, the arterial blood gas is repeated with nasal cannula at 2 lpm and presents pH 7.28, PaCO2 70 mmHg, PaO2 62 mmHg. Indicate the correct course of action:

options.B: Proceed with orotracheal intubation and initiate mechanical ventilation.
options.C: Increase oxygen therapy until achieving an oxygen saturation (SatO2) of at least 99%.
options.D: Combine benzodiazepines with high flows of oxygen to ensure a decrease in tachypnea and improve the ventilation pattern.

d4722a45-84c0-463d-bd6c-b35baec514d6.question: 16-year-old woman who begins follow-up in the adult Neurology consultation, referred from Neuropediatrics with the diagnosis of juvenile myoclonic epilepsy (JME). She is on treatment with valproic acid and well controlled. Would you consider making any changes to her treatment?

options.A: No, because valproic acid is the treatment of choice in patients with this epileptic syndrome.
options.B: No, because the patient is free of episodes and changing it at this moment would be assuming unnecessary risks.
options.C: Yes, because its use should be avoided in women of childbearing age, as it is the antiepileptic drug with the highest teratogenicity and causes problems in the neurodevelopment of children.
options.D: Yes, due to the relationship of this drug with polycystic ovary syndrome.

b09add68-5bed-4d48-822e-e1a27199438f.question: A 79-year-old man with a history of mild cognitive impairment presents with a sudden onset of right homonymous hemianopsia, aphasia, and right inferior facial paresis. Upon his arrival to the emergency department, his blood pressure is recorded: 190/85 mmHg. A head CT is performed, revealing a left frontal lobar intraparenchymal hematoma and another left occipital hematoma. What is the most likely etiology of these hematomas?:

3f86890e-be94-40ed-97ca-f6a99cc7da13.question: A 60-year-old woman is being studied for various episodes of loss of consciousness. The differential diagnosis is considered between epileptic seizures and syncope. Indicate which of the following data would not support the diagnosis of syncope:

options.A: Incontinence of sphincters during the episode.
options.D: Jerking of all four limbs lasting 1-2 seconds, during the episode.

557e4ca9-9736-4b3a-9bd1-2d36d7d31c1f.question: A 70-year-old man consults due to non-radiating lumbar pain lasting 1 week, of progressive intensity, accompanied by a marked limitation of the spine's mobility and low-grade fever. The lumbar spine x-ray shows no alterations. What diagnosis should we rule out first and with what technique?

options.B: Bone metastases with bone scintigraphy using technetium.
options.C: Ankylosing vertebral hyperostosis with radiography of the dorsolumbar spine.
options.D: Pyogenic spondylodiscitis with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

3f8fef5c-cc16-4440-9cbe-5eeb11fa338d.question: A 60-year-old woman consults due to numbness of the right hand that has been evolving for months, which awakens her at night and forces her to mobilize the hand until it passes. It seems that she has lost strength and sometimes things have fallen from that hand. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: If the neurological examination shows numbness in the first to third fingers, we will consider impairment of the ulnar nerve at the epitrochlear level.
options.B: If the neurological examination shows numbness in the first to third fingers, we will consider the possibility of median nerve involvement at the level of the carpal tunnel.
options.C: To make a diagnosis, it is not necessary to perform an electromyography, since the physical examination presents very good probability coefficients.
options.D: The treatment for ulnar nerve involvement at the epitrochlear level or median nerve at the carpal level is surgical intervention, since conservative treatment does not improve the symptoms.

97d99629-888b-492d-b91c-0aefeb941fc8.question: Regarding temporal arteritis, indicate the incorrect answer:

options.A: It mainly occurs in white individuals and those over 50 years old.
options.B: Approximately a quarter of patients develop an aneurysm or dilation of the thoracic aorta.
options.C: Unilateral or bilateral vision loss is one of the most serious complications.
options.D: The highest incidence occurs between the sixth and seventh decade of life.

cbb00460-b28f-4e6f-bf2c-b39eb8fb19c2.question: Which of the following statements is true in relation to Leriche syndrome?

options.A: It is a clinical picture that includes the triad of plantar claudication, impotence coeundi, and absence of distal pulses.
options.B: It is the result of a bilateral femoropopliteal occlusion.
options.D: The arteriography is the first diagnostic test to be performed.

a81e293e-7d33-4f4a-877a-c6e3670c4c96.question: 73-year-old man with a history of acute myocardial infarction treated with percutaneous transluminal coronary angioplasty 6 weeks ago. He comes to the emergency department due to sudden pain, coldness, and loss of mobility in the right lower limb. On examination, the right femoral pulse is present, with absence of the rest of the pulses in that limb. He maintains pulses at all levels in the contralateral limb. Regarding the suspected diagnosis, point out the false statement:

options.A: The most likely cause is of embolic origin.
options.B: Paralysis is a late onset sign indicating that revascularization treatment should be performed as soon as possible.
options.C: The treatment consists of femoral arterial embolectomy with a Fogarty catheter.
options.D: In case of rigid paralysis with deep anesthesia and absence of Doppler signal, an urgent arteriography is indicated.

3302814a-8b0e-41d6-b987-31cc0060fbd3.question: A 60-year-old man, a smoker of 40 packs/year, who consults for pain in the ulnar edge of the left arm and left palpebral ptosis for a month. The chest x-ray shows a mass in the left upper lobe and the CT scan confirms the lesion with invasion of the second rib. In relation to the suspected diagnosis, the most appropriate treatment is:

options.A: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy with combined chemoradiotherapy, followed by surgery.
options.B: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy without surgery, followed by radiotherapy.
options.D: Radiotherapy without chemotherapy, followed by surgery.

8314f00c-0f57-4dde-8687-654853b8e394.question: 35-year-old man, admitted for severe chest trauma with multiple rib fractures. After responding favorably to treatment with painkillers and oxygen, he begins to present severe hypoxemia. Indicate the most probable cause of this deterioration:

options.A: The instability of the chest wall due to multiple fractures.
options.C: The alteration of gas exchange due to lung contusion.

dcba258a-f68c-4aaa-8b59-22021dae999b.question: A 65-year-old man consults due to solid dysphagia for the past two months. The esophagoscopy reveals a tumor 30 cm from the dental arch, partially stenotic, with histopathology of squamous cell carcinoma. Endoscopic ultrasonography and PET-CT are requested where no pathological adenopathies are observed. Which of the following options would be the most correct?:

options.B: Esophagectomy according to the Ivor Lewis technique.

03bfac96-15e3-45e4-b639-db7781f49182.question: What is the most appropriate time for the administration of antibiotic prophylaxis in abdominal surgery?

options.A: From 48 hours before the surgical intervention.
options.B: In the 30 minutes prior to the start of the surgical intervention.
options.C: In the 30 minutes following the closure of the surgical incision.
options.D: It should only be applied if contamination of the surgical field is observed during the procedure.

6868f18b-6bbe-4b61-b934-112b846ea4f9.question: Regarding Lynch syndrome or hereditary nonpolyposis colorectal carcinoma, indicate the correct answer:

options.A: It is an autosomal recessive disorder.
options.B: The phenotype includes a predominance of malignant colon tumors on the right side.
options.C: The polyp-cancer progression is slower than in sporadic colon cancer.
options.D: Extracolonic malignant tumors usually settle in the lung or liver.

eea09f9c-575b-49cc-91d7-633d90b62757.question: A 67 year-old obese woman, who comes to the emergency room due to abdominal pain in the upper right quadrant of the abdomen, fever of 39.5°C, and very dark urine. Given this picture, the first suspicion should be:

8a75c493-3176-478a-bdcf-fe81134596a9.question: 47-year-old patient, with no relevant pathological history. The patient presents a case of fever and pain in the tip of the right side and has been diagnosed with community-acquired pneumonia at their Health Center. In a simple control x-ray, performed 3 days after the start of antibiotic treatment, an ipsilateral pleural effusion is identified that occupies a third of the right hemithorax. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The diagnosis of pleural empyema can be established if a thoracentesis is performed and the pH of the pleural fluid is 7.4.
options.B: The diagnosis of pleural empyema is only confirmed if a microorganism is found in the pleural fluid culture.
options.C: A pleural empyema should be suspected if the patient continues to have fever and leukocytosis.
options.D: The presence of a pleural effusion is sufficient to establish the diagnosis of pleural empyema and to place a right pleural drain.

4e9b1f64-38ba-4774-a822-2742643f4b86.question: A 35-year-old male, transferred to the emergency room after a traffic accident. Upon admission, a Glasgow scale score of 15 is observed, blood pressure of 140/90 mmHg, respiratory rate of 35 rpm and heart rate of 110 bpm, with a baseline oxygen saturation of 91%. On examination, there is right thoracic hypophonesis and tympanism to percussion. What is the presumptive diagnosis?

4063a3b8-6910-4184-b1b0-9f8adfc3a0d3.question: A 64-year-old man consulted due to presenting increasing weakness in the lower limbs and ascending paresthesias over the last 3 days. The examination shows weakness in the lower limbs and global areflexia. The blood tests and chest x-ray are normal. Lumbar puncture reveals cerebrospinal fluid with 3 mononuclear cells, 60 mg of glucose, and 97 mg of total proteins. Indicate the incorrect statement:

options.A: The symptoms are consistent with an autoimmune polyradiculoneuropathy.
options.B: In these cases, facial paralysis can occur in up to 50% of the instances.
options.C: In severe cases, these conditions can be associated with autonomic neuropathy.
options.D: The treatment of choice for these conditions is the administration of intravenous corticosteroids.

cd0dceca-1a54-4dcf-977b-2343ba708c98.question: A 48-year-old patient who has suffered a subarachnoid hemorrhage due to an anterior communicating aneurysm. 10 days after the bleeding, they show altered levels of consciousness and develop hemiparesis. Point out the incorrect answer:

options.A: Vasospasm occurs most frequently between days 4 and 14 after subarachnoid hemorrhage.
options.B: The greater the amount of initial bleeding, the higher the risk of rebleeding.
options.C: Water restriction is advised in these patients due to the risk of hyponatremia.
options.D: It is necessary to perform a cranial CT scan in order to rule out other complications.

c774a5cd-6870-423d-81ca-f511846f369f.question: A 93-year-old woman with a history of COPD, hypertension, dyslipidemia, atrial fibrillation and ischemic heart disease. She lives alone. She has a left ventricular ejection fraction of 53%, creatinine 1.5 mg/dL, normal coagulation. She is treated with inhaled bronchodilators and ASA 100 mg daily. She has a fall on the street, after which she finds it impossible to stand and sit, with intense pain in the right hip during movement, great shortening and external rotation of the leg. How and when should this be treated?:

options.A: Admission for transthoracic ultrasound, evaluation by Cardiology and then closed reduction and fixation with a screw plate.
options.B: Admission for evaluation by Nephrology and Cardiology, and then Traumatology will decide whether to use an arthroplasty or a trochanteric nail.
options.C: Admission to Internal Medicine/Geriatrics, progressive stabilization of comorbidities, conservative orthopedic treatment.
options.D: Closed reduction and fixation of the fracture within 48 hours, very early sitting, orthogeriatric management.

d426d52f-4bac-4173-b4bb-7df5a738434d.question: A 73-year-old woman with a medical history of obesity, type 2 diabetes mellitus, high blood pressure, and dyslipidemia. She consults due to unbearable pain in her right knee developing over 5 days, with no prior trauma. Examination reveals a globular knee, moderate varus, limited extension and flexion due to pain, diffuse medial pain. The radiographs show osteophytes and mild pinching of the medial joint space. What would be your initial management?

options.A: Explanation of the diagnosis, relative rest, paracetamol 1 g/8 h plus metamizol 500 mg /8 h, rescue naproxen.
options.B: Preferred referral to outpatient Traumatology consultations for the evaluation of cemented total prosthesis.
options.C: Preferred referral to Traumatology outpatient consultations to assess arthroscopic debridement.
options.D: Request for preferential magnetic resonance imaging for evaluation of meniscopathy, Baker's cyst and/or tendinitis.

c7662c0b-2a7d-4100-8354-62d289b53708.question: A 7-year-old boy was brought to the emergency room after falling from a swing onto his right hand. He has no relevant medical history. He presents with a deformity on the back of the fork of the wrist and functional impotence, with a normal distal neurovascular situation. What injury do you expect to find in the urgent X-ray requested?

b42eeacb-08c8-47dc-83ec-f7c00e6a1dea.question: A 65-year-old obese woman, who suffers a fall on her hand with her elbow extended. She presents arm pain with swelling and functional impairment, and is unable to extend her wrist and fingers. It is most likely that she presents:

options.C: Diaphyseal fracture of the humerus associated with a double forearm fracture.
options.D: Diaphyseal fracture of the humerus with injury to the radial nerve.

2dbd95db-3f02-4630-80bf-1ae6ec8cb213.question: The most likely diagnosis for a 74-year-old patient who has begun experiencing lower back pain radiating to the lower limbs, neurogenic claudication, and limitation in trunk extension for the past two months is:

433c8a65-9f20-4db8-864d-436ded4de6ab.question: A 70-year-old woman, who is diabetic and hypertensive, suffers a fall at her home, presenting a 9 cm wound that communicates with a focus of fracture in the right tibia. Radiographically, an oblique short fracture is observed in the middle-distal third of the tibia. She undergoes emergency surgery with cleaning (Friedrich) and placement of a locked intramedullary nail. At 11 months, she presents with atrophic nonunion of the tibia with suppuration in the area of the wound. What will be her best immediate therapeutic option?:

options.A: Triple antibiotic therapy (gram-positive, gram-negative and anaerobic) and cleaning of the surgical wound, removing the distal staples to promote bone consolidation.
options.B: Watchful waiting and antibiotic treatment with quinolones.
options.C: Contribution of autograft and growth factors (BMP 2 and 7) to stimulate the process of bone consolidation, which is delayed.
options.D: Removal of the nail, debridement, placement of external fixator and antibiotic therapy adjusted to the results of the cultures.

d9dfa8ef-ece6-4f5d-ae7c-14b8f189cfb5.question: What type of dementia should be considered in a patient who presents cognitive impairment, visual hallucinations, parkinsonian signs, and poor tolerance to neuroleptics?

ff68c835-7bb5-497c-8fe7-c39539dc3029.question: 92-year-old male, with no relevant pathological history, diagnosed 24 hours ago with acute pyelonephritis, presenting visual hallucinations, incoherent speech, and psychomotor agitation. Which of the following statements best matches the clinical picture he is presenting now?:

options.A: This refers to the typical onset of dementia in an elderly patient with a serious infection.
options.B: This is a case of delirium in an elderly patient with a severe infection.
options.C: This is the onset of an acute psychotic episode (late-onset schizophrenia in the elderly).
options.D: This is an episode of severe depression due to hospitalization with associated psychotic symptoms.

6e3390eb-e468-4664-b527-3f3dfb87c260.question: Regarding geriatric syndromes, one of the following answers is incorrect:

options.A: These are illness situations with a high incidence and prevalence in the elderly population.
options.B: They are usually the result of several convergent etiologies, which require a multidimensional evaluation and intervention.
options.C: They usually produce significant consequences, both medical and functional, that require a multidimensional intervention.
options.D: Its prevalence is higher in hospitalized older patients than in dependent and institutionalized older patients.

111fce02-5f7f-40d8-abb3-19e8357d6917.question: Fragility is a state that can lead to significant negative consequences. Of the following answers, indicate the incorrect one:

options.A: It is associated with a good number of consequences, such as falls, immobility, disability, higher rate of hospital admissions and institutionalization, and higher mortality.
options.B: Its early detection would allow for early intervention to prevent its negative consequences.
options.C: Its prevalence has no direct relationship with chronological age.
options.D: The walking speed and the Timed Up&Go test, allow its detection in regular clinical practice.

538d33a2-a2df-457f-879a-5aab27eb71cf.question: Urinary incontinence is one of the main geriatric syndromes. Which of the following statements is incorrect?:

options.A: Its prevalence is higher in patients with chronic neurological pathology and/or immobility syndrome than in patients hospitalized for an acute illness.
options.B: The most common clinical type of urinary incontinence, in the older population in general, is urgency incontinence.
options.C: Pharmacological treatment has shown greater clinical effectiveness in urgency incontinence / overactive bladder than in other types of incontinence.
options.D: The treatment of urge incontinence with antimuscarinics is recommended for patients with cognitive impairment or severe stage dementia.

7c2f7c3f-8d6c-4575-bf8d-0a9269fc69eb.question: Which of the following is not a stage of Prochaska and DiClemente's behavior change model?

6fe92eb7-dc4b-4260-b45e-0dcf752da828.question: A 65 year old woman, who three months ago experienced a vesicant skin eruption over the right D6 dermatome, accompanied by very intense pain. After the formation of scabs, the situation resolved itself, but moderate pain persists, intensifying upon touch and preventing the use of underwear over the affected dermatome. In this situation, what treatment would not be recommended?:

30950f1c-ee33-4ca2-a4ad-8fe125323087.question: Evidence-Based Medicine recommends the PICO structure for formulating clinical questions. Which of the following is not an element included in the formulation of the PICO question?:

options.A: Type of intervention to be evaluated.

b15a91c9-441b-45f8-991f-bc031f6011c7.question: Which of the following strategies constitutes a primary prevention action against abuse towards women?:

options.A: Establish a protection and escape plan for women victims of abuse with young children in their care.
options.B: Educational activities with pregnant women and their partners on equal relationships and co-responsibility in child-rearing.
options.C: Implement a routine screening protocol in women who come to hospital emergency services due to anxiety crises.
options.D: Early notification to the judicial authority in case of any suspicion of abuse.

2a3d882e-da23-4bf8-b527-f7e86076942e.question: Indicate which of the following therapeutic groups has been shown to reduce cardiovascular and total morbidity and mortality in hypertensive patients, over 55 years of age, and with a history of cardiovascular events or diabetes:

d0ad90a9-e6a3-4cd3-a148-610c6e9d689d.question: A 65-year-old male who consulted due to an episode of frank, painless hematuria two days ago, with no accompanying symptoms. The medical history does not indicate suspicion of a particular origin and the urine strip from that day reveals the existence of hematuria, although the urine is clear. What test would you first request to guide the diagnosis?:

be7abd1e-b5d3-4e5c-acb5-b046736586fe.question: Which of the following statements corresponds to the term quaternary prevention?

options.A: Activities aimed at preventing the occurrence or reducing the prevalence of risk factors in healthy individuals.
options.B: Interventions aimed at preventing or reducing the risks of contact with health services.
options.C: Rehabilitation and social reintegration activities in patients with clinically manifest diseases.
options.D: Screening activities and vaccination for healthcare personnel at risk of infectious diseases.

6b9d78e6-e76e-4884-9d8a-7c6b0140e506.question: According to Fried's physical frailty phenotype, which evaluates five criteria (weight loss, low energy, weak strength, slowness, and low physical activity), how many criteria must be met for an elderly person to be considered frail?

f0e420cc-3e02-4a41-9d3a-12309123a482.question: Patient with chronic heart failure in whom we detect prominent "v" waves in the jugular venous pulse and a holosystolic murmur in the xiphoid appendix area that intensifies with deep inspiration. What valvular disease does this physical examination suggest?

aa9941d5-97ad-4c37-9e95-ce93c0b7703d.question: A 26-year-old woman consults for a feeling of generalized weakness that has progressively set in over the course of three weeks, becoming particularly intense in the last two days. She has been reporting episodes of joint pain in her hands for a couple of years that have required the intake of anti-inflammatories, as well as the appearance of some erythematous lesion of unexplained cause in the cleavage area, mainly in the summer. A physical examination reveals only obvious skin-mucous pallor and a heart rate of 100 bpm. The blood count shows: Hb 6 gr/dL, Ht 27%, MCV 105 fL, 3420 leukocytes/mm3 (2300 neutrophils/mm3, 800 lymphocytes/mm3, 250 monocytes/mm3, 50 eosinophils/mm3, 20 basophils/mm3), platelets 170,000/mm3. In biochemistry: AST 30 UI/L, ALT 35 UI/L, GGT 59 UI/L, alkaline phosphatase 105 UI/L, LDH 490 UI/L, urea 20 mg/dL, creatinine 0.8 mg/dL. Considering the available information, indicate which of the following additional analytical parameters you would need to know in order to make the most appropriate immediate decision:

29053db0-39ab-4a67-ac4a-9bd0ae13ac23.question: A 60-year-old man was diagnosed with scleroderma eleven years ago, with a long-standing Raynaud's phenomenon and a sensation of gastroesophageal reflux. Physical examination highlighted facial telangiectasias and sclerodactyly. Positive antinuclear antibodies (titles of 1/2,560) with a centromeric immunofluorescence pattern, positive anticentromere antibodies. He presents with dyspnea that has been intensifying for three months, which in recent weeks has intensified to affect his usual physical activity, without edemas, orthopnea or paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea. Normal cardiac and respiratory auscultation. The blood test shows normal blood count and liver and kidney functions. Only a rise in atrial natriuretic peptide (pro-BNP) stands out. Considering the information provided, what should be your first diagnostic suspicion?:

24689b66-a32f-474b-87f7-0c5ebc9faf26.question: A 45-year-old patient with a history of HIV infection diagnosed 6 years ago is consulting about restarting antiretroviral treatment. The patient stopped it two years ago for personal reasons and partly due to adverse effects, when they had an undetectable viral load and 230 CD4 lymphocytes; in recent months, they have suffered a herpes zoster outbreak. Indicate the correct answer regarding the resumption of treatment:

options.A: If it is not possible to ensure adequate adherence to treatment, it is best not to restart it due to the risk of developing resistances.
options.B: At this moment, a resistance study would be indicated to know the present mutations and guide the resumption of the treatment.
options.C: Dual therapy with dolutegravir and lamivudine could be just as effective in this situation as triple therapy, as it could reduce some of the adverse effects.
options.D: The best option for this patient could be a combination based on boosted protease inhibitors.

a83abd3e-ae0e-4ea3-88ec-a5052e630851.question: A 22-year-old male, who practices adventure sports, presents with bilateral facial paralysis. A couple of months ago, he reports having suffered, for an approximate period of four weeks, an episode of generalized weakness, fever, intense headache, and joint and muscle pain. Despite having substantially improved, some fluctuating headache and joint pain persist. The cardiorespiratory, abdominal, and neurological examinations are completely normal, with present and symmetrical osteotendinous reflexes. The chest radiograph is also normal. What is, most likely, the cause of the clinical picture described?

57df6e8b-03cd-47be-aa08-c0104f9c4919.question: A 45-year-old man consults for a general deterioration of his state over the past 3 weeks, which is added to an episode of hemoptoic expectoration in the last few hours. Normal physical examination. Notable in the blood analysis are: normal blood count; ESR 70 mm/h; creatinine 1.8 mg/dl. In the urine analysis, microhematuria (60 red blood cells/field) and proteinuria (1.2 g/24h) are observed. In the CT scan of the chest, cavitated lung nodules are seen, with bilateral perihilar location. Which of the following statements is true?:

options.A: The presence of intense peripheral eosinophilia (> 1,000 cells/μL) is a characteristic of the disease.
options.B: Without treatment, over 80% of patients exhibit favorable progress with resolution of the condition.
options.C: Rituximab has been shown to be effective for inducing remission in generalized forms with renal involvement.
options.D: Around 90% of patients with kidney involvement show positivity for antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies with specificity against myeloperoxidase.

d2141580-134f-4c43-8ae5-caf1f8cdd5a4.question: A 27-year-old male with a history of mild neurocognitive deficit and behavior disorder beginning in childhood, and chronic liver dysfunction (aspartate aminotransferase 78U/L (5- 40 U/L), alanine aminotransferase 80U/L (5-40 U/L)). In the last six months he has developed a gait disturbance. He is referred to the emergency room for headache, vomiting, food refusal, and drowsiness in the context of a flu syndrome. The physical examination reveals a temperature of 37.7°C, decreased consciousness (Glasgow 11), pupils with little reactivity, cerebellar ataxia and spastic paraparesis. Which of the following statements is true regarding his diagnosis and treatment?

options.A: Wilson's disease. Request blood cultures, schedule empirical antibiotic treatment and discharge to home after resolution of the fever.
options.B: Tropical spastic paraparesis. Administer hydration, ensure oral intake, request HIV testing and discharge to home after fever resolution.
options.C: Congenital metabolic disease of the urea cycle. Suspend protein intake, administer glucose, request analysis with ammonia, and prepare sodium benzoate.
options.D: Alpha-1 antitrypsin deficiency. Perform lumbar puncture, administer acyclovir and valproic acid in suspicion of meningitis and status epilepticus.

fc10301d-af25-44c0-bfb6-01f60feb0f7d.question: An 87-year-old man, diagnosed with type 2 diabetes mellitus, chronic kidney failure, COPD, and heart failure, with a score on the Barthel Index of basic daily living activities of 30 points. What would be the appropriate therapeutic objective in the glycemic control of this patient?

421f79f9-a3a5-4547-bd2c-91e54176f9aa.question: 72-year-old man who has been presenting with a fever of 38.7°C, cough, purulent expectoration, and dyspnea for 48 hours. Constants: BP 85/60 mmHg, heart rate 100 bpm, respiratory rate 35 rpm, SatO2 80%. He is notably confused and has crepitus in the lower left lung field. The chest X-ray confirms the presence of pneumonia in the lingula and the lower left lobe. What would be the appropriate place for care?:

options.B: Admission to an emergency observation unit.
options.D: Admission to the Intensive Care Unit.

0a3741b4-cada-4a0f-8ba3-ec05200ba6e7.question: A 45-year-old man diagnosed with poorly controlled arterial hypertension presents with a fever of 38.8°C that began 2 days ago, severe retrosternal pain radiating to the neck and both arms, which lessens when he leans forward and increases in the supine position. The ECG shows elevation of the ST segment in leads I, II and AVF and from V1 to V6, with no alteration of the QRS complex. The echocardiogram reveals moderate pericardial effusion. Which of the following criteria indicates a poor prognosis and advises hospital admission?:

options.A: Acute course (acute onset of chest pain).
options.B: History of poorly controlled high blood pressure.

1999eb87-b798-4f21-88cd-dde6a70f954c.question: A patient with HIV infection undergoing antiretroviral treatment shows 560 copies of HIV-1 RNA in his routine analysis. The patient is asymptomatic, the CD4s are stable at 280/mm3 and he ensures he is correctly taking the treatment. The most appropriate approach to take is:

options.A: Determine plasma levels of drugs to ensure that these are within therapeutic margins.
options.B: Repeat the viral load in a few weeks to confirm if it is a blip.
options.C: Conduct a genotypic resistance study to verify the existence of resistance mutations to the drugs used.
options.D: Intensify the treatment in the event of a failure in a patient with an advanced HIV infection.

4e0dac89-640d-4f2b-bed7-0180f526f4da.question: The following characteristics suggest the presence of a secondary Raynaud's phenomenon, except:

bef68d5d-d3cb-4064-8fcd-8ac019a305b2.question: A 57-year-old man presents to the emergency room with severe epigastric pain, radiating to the back and right hypochondrium, along with nausea and vomiting that have lasted for 12 hours. Upon examination, he is afebrile, hemodynamically stable, lucid, and well perfused. Lab findings reveal 18,000 leukocytes (80% neutrophils), with the rest of the complete blood count being normal. Other biochemistry, including calcium, LDH and triglycerides, is normal, except for an amylase level of 3,000 U/L. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The clinical picture suggests acute cholangitis.
options.B: The patient likely has acute mesenteric ischemia.
options.C: It is not necessary to perform imaging tests in emergencies or in any case an abdominal ultrasound.
options.D: It is necessary to perform an urgent abdominal CT scan.

f7d99b6a-8cab-411c-961a-b2c07485f4e1.question: 65-year-old man, under follow-up in the clinic for asthenia, anorexia and low-grade fever of insidious course. Abdominal CT is performed with findings of a retroperitoneal mass and periaortitis, and a test with elevated ESR, moderate anemia and positive antinuclear antibodies. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: It is due to idiopathic retroperitoneal fibrosis and does not require further diagnostic tests.
options.B: The diagnosis is clinical and an empirical treatment with broad-spectrum antibiotics should be conducted.
options.C: The determination of elevated levels of immunoglobulins confirms the diagnosis.
options.D: Requires a histological diagnosis showing a diffuse infiltration of plasma cells and more than 10 IgG4-positive cells per field.

54c2dc08-58ec-45f6-a6fb-60a299caf3b9.question: A 77-year-old man comes to the emergency room due to a decline in his level of consciousness. In his medical history, he reports fatigue, loss of appetite, and weight loss in the recent weeks. Upon his arrival, he shows a low-grade fever of 37.7°C without a defined source. A head CT scan is carried out with no significant findings, and in the CSF obtained after a lumbar puncture, a slightly xanthochromic fluid is observed, with the following data: opening pressure 22 cm of H2O; cells 98, 100% mononuclear; glucose 5 mg/dL; total proteins 2 g/L. What is the most likely etiology?

12aff0e0-31c0-4054-93ba-ccc37975eec8.question: A 67-year-old woman with a history of dyslipidemia, who goes to the emergency room for a picture of dysuria and polyakiuria followed by fever, chills, and general health deterioration. Upon arrival, she appears severe and is tachycardic, tachypneic, with a blood pressure of 60/40 mmHg and a temperature of 39°C. Which of the following measures would not be included in the INITIAL management?:

25ad35dd-50a7-457f-8042-378b6b74eb43.question: Which of the following statements is correct regarding cardiopulmonary resuscitation?:

options.A: After confirming the absence of a pulse, basic cardiopulmonary resuscitation should be performed following the pattern of 30 chest compressions and 2 lung inflations.
options.B: As soon as the necessary means are available, a cardioversion should be performed if the patient has not yet regained a pulse.
options.C: In the event of asystole, 3 mg of atropine should be administered.
options.D: Adrenaline, at doses of 1 mg every 3 minutes, should not be administered if the cause of arrest is ventricular fibrillation.

85dca134-6527-4901-84e2-a3d6e4d67f28.question: A patient is brought to the emergency department from a fire that occurred in a closed warehouse where there was polyurethane foam. He is conscious, but exhibits increasing mental clumsiness, headache, and intense shortness of breath. The oxygen saturation as measured by pulse oximetry is 92% and the capillary lactate acid is 8 mEq/l. What specific treatment do you consider most appropriate?

options.A: Administration of oxygen through a 50% Venturi type mask.
options.D: Fluid therapy with infusion of physiological saline solution at 21 ml/h.

7ca5039a-6d97-4288-a985-f8ffa969a247.question: An 18-year-old man arrives at the hospital's emergency department, transported by a basic life support unit. He was hit by a car while cycling. Upon arrival, he has a heart rate of 115 bpm, a blood pressure of 110/75 mmHg, a palpable radial pulse, a capillary refill of 2.5 seconds, and a respiratory rate of 25 rpm. What do these data indicate to us?:

options.A: They have lost between 15 and 30% of their blood volume and require volume replacement.
options.B: They have lost more than 30% of their blood volume and require replenishment of volume and blood.
options.C: He has lost more than 40% of his blood volume and will require surgical treatment.
options.D: They have lost more than 50% of their blood volume and require replenishment of volume and blood.

2e08d662-2041-415a-a1d6-eeec0efdb1da.question: A 25-year-old woman diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus, who has been in remission for the past 2 years. She consults because of polyarthralgia and low-grade fever. Which of the following alterations would indicate a reactivation of the disease?:

options.A: Elevation of anti-native DNA antibodies and complement factors.
options.B: Elevation of anti-native DNA antibodies and decrease of complement factors.
options.C: Decrease in native anti-DNA antibodies and complement factors.
options.D: Decrease in native anti-DNA antibodies and elevation of complement factors.

e7225a0a-78d2-4f0b-9401-88ab72a95b88.question: Considering the clinical relevance of positive likelihood ratios (LR+) for the decision-making process according to The Evidence-Based Medicine Working Group. Which of the following options corresponds to moderate increases in the probability of confirming the disease?:

044547cc-9a83-450e-99ba-f9f99afb5ea3.question: Which of the following factors is not associated with the development of pigment stones in the gallbladder?:

options.C: Chronic infection of the bile ducts.

3c3827be-11aa-498b-8b0b-fd6f1201d2e9.question: The combination of drugs that inhibit the angiotensin-converting enzyme and antagonists of aldosterone can be useful in some patients with heart failure. However, we must be especially vigilant in these cases:

options.A: The appearance or worsening of dyslipidemias.
options.B: That can paradoxically increase the blood pressure figures.

options.A: It may be related to the administration of bisphosphonates.
options.B: It is associated in most cases with previous radiation therapy.
options.C: The treatment of choice is mandibulectomy.
options.D: It is a form of developmental mandibular atrophy.

options.B: It affects men and women equally.
options.C: Currently, they are undergoing a curative treatment based on the administration of glucocorticoids.
options.D: It is a recessive hereditary disease linked to the X chromosome.

a2b7b524-e014-4c37-9efe-aeefe2e4fbef.question: A 60-year-old man with abdominal pain and upper digestive bleeding, in whom an abdominal tumor related to the gastric wall is found. The histology shows a spindle cell tumor with few mitoses, positive for CD117. The most likely diagnosis is:

ba398476-c2aa-419c-b7b8-ae2cb96aa977.question: What is the best measure of the global burden of a disease?

options.A: The years lost due to disability attributable to that disease.
options.C: Years of life adjusted for disability attributable to that disease.
options.D: The economic cost of the disease.

07147b73-8169-4f7b-9a4d-4ff532c3f4a6.question: In which individuals is an elevation in plasma levels of the BB isoenzyme of creatine kinase (CK) observed?

options.B: In patients with acute myocardial infarction.
options.D: In patients with acute hepatocellular injury.

06ebad3b-6db1-4c42-9e4b-f32864645a81.question: In 2018, James Allison and Tasuku Honjo received the Nobel Prize in Medicine for the discovery of the CTLA-4 and PD-1 molecules, which represents a significant advancement in cancer immunotherapy. The treatment of cancer patients with anti-PD1 antibodies (such as pembrolizumab) is based on this:

options.A: The anti-PD1 antibody binds to the PD-1 receptor expressed in tumor cells, inducing their death by apoptosis.
options.B: The anti-PD1 antibody acts as a bridge between the tumor cell and its ligands in the T lymphocytes, promoting tumor destruction by cytotoxic lymphocytes.
options.C: The anti-PD1 antibody promotes the opsonization of the tumor cell and its elimination by phagocytic cells.
options.D: The anti-PD1 antibody blocks the function of the PD-1 receptor, which acts as a negative regulator of T lymphocytes activity, thereby allowing their activation.

abaf56f3-6409-46a6-a921-841b825427e1.question: The term "public health nurse" as a description of nurses who worked to promote health and prevent diseases in large concentrations of poor immigrants at the beginning of the twentieth century, is attributed to:

eebe9907-f11b-4c5f-95b1-d07461c82c80.question: Who performed the first blood pressure measurement in 1733?

ac52f054-c6b6-4e7b-86b5-152b18f3e5da.question: Which conceptual nursing model refers to resistance lines as representation of protective factors that help the patient defend against a stressor?

options.A: The conservation model of Myra Estrine Levine.
options.B: The conceptual system of Imogene M. King.
options.D: The adaptation model of Callista Roy.

9d4816aa-073d-4ee1-a1f4-f1c5bf4b73d5.question: According to Patricia Benner and her Theory from Novice to Expert: Excellence and Mastery in Clinical Nursing Practice, when the nurse is able to recognize the most important aspects and has an intuitive mastery of the situation based on the previous information known, it corresponds to the stage of:

7693d51f-4b71-4132-a55a-c90f4b1e95a7.question: Indicate the regulation where the details of the nursing care report are specified, which include, among other things, active nursing diagnoses, nursing outcomes, and nursing interventions:

options.A: Law 41/2002, of November 14, basic regulator of patient autonomy and rights and obligations in terms of information and clinical documentation.
options.B: Law 11/2007, of June 22, on electronic access of citizens to Public Services and its development regulations.
options.C: Law 16/2003, of May 28, on cohesion and quality of the National Health System.
options.D: Royal Decree 1093/2010, of September 3, which approves the minimum set of data for clinical reports in the National Health System.

7f504003-a28e-480f-a498-ff35e66b1a06.question: Indicate the correct answer in relation to the NANDA nursing diagnoses taxonomy 2021-2023:

options.A: The diagnosis of neonatal hypothermia has been withdrawn.
options.B: One of the new diagnoses is maladaptive grief.
options.C: The diagnosis of urinary incontinence associated with disability has been modified to functional urinary incontinence.
options.D: The diagnosis ineffective self-management of family health has been withdrawn.

470b8d9b-14a7-48ad-b46c-2b792c184e7d.question: According to Riegel, the theory of self-care for chronic diseases encompasses 3 key concepts, which are:

options.A: Maintenance, monitoring and management of self-care.
options.C: Need, adaptation, and management of care.

21a4b38f-4e1d-4572-9ae5-d6ae89e80da3.question: According to the Royal Decree 576/2023, of July 4, which modifies the Royal Decree 99/2011, of January 28, which regulates the official doctoral teachings, indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The duration of doctoral studies will be a maximum of three years full-time, or a maximum duration of six years part-time, counting from the date of enrollment in the program until the date of the submission of the doctoral thesis.
options.B: Access will be granted to those who hold official Spanish university degrees or equivalent Spanish titles, provided that they have completed at least 240 ECTS in the sum of these teachings and can accredit a level 3 in the Spanish Framework of Qualifications for Higher Education.
options.C: University graduates who, after obtaining a place in training in the corresponding entrance exam for specialized health training positions, have successfully completed with positive evaluation at least one year of training in a program for the official degree of any of the specialties in Health Sciences, can access.
options.D: Those who are in possession of another Doctorate degree may access.

ff6577f4-83c9-4789-b45e-cad13647d955.question: Indicate the correct answer in relation to the rights and duties on the custody, protection or transfer of data in a care relationship:

options.A: Users and patients of the health system have the obligation to provide the necessary data about their health status in a loyal manner, in accordance with truthfulness and contribute to its acquisition, especially in cases where it is necessary for healthcare reasons or matters of public interest.
options.B: The owner of the health information is the patient or user of the health system. In case of incapacity, the owner of the information will be the relatives connected to the patient for reasons of kinship or their legal representative, with no need to give the patient information adapted to their understanding or to obtain their explicit or tacit permission.
options.C: Personal data legally has the characteristic of being able to be used for a different purpose or one not compatible with the purpose for which they were collected, without legally obtaining the consent of the affected person, as long as the duty of confidentiality is not violated.
options.D: Informed consent is essential for any health-related intervention, being especially necessary in cases of serious risk to the physical or psychological integrity of the patient or in cases of risk to public health.

16832101-2e80-4e4b-9586-8ce24f17685c.question: Indicate the correct answer in relation to the ethical duty to ensure that the dignity of the person and their legitimate wishes are respected in the healthcare process at the end of life:

options.A: In the event that the patient has made a Living Will, Testamentary Will, or Advanced Directives, the instructions in such a document should prevail in every act derived from the care relationship, except in cases where treatments and therapeutic alternatives are provided to prolong the life of the patients.
options.B: End-of-life care adapts actions and treatments to the main objective of relieving the patient's suffering and achieving maximum comfort while respecting their legitimate rights; representing the highest exponent of the bioethical principle of decision-making autonomy.
options.C: The person who is in the end-of-life process has the right to receive clinical information in a comprehensible, appropriate, and understandable terms, and, given the importance of this information, there is no possibility in this case for the patient to reject the information.
options.D: The person who is in the final stages of life has the right at all times to receive information suitable to their wishes, understanding of language, and adapted to their current situation. Their wish to refuse the withdrawal of a treatment can only be carried out according to the law if it aligns with the clinical criterion.

4a33d6bc-47e3-442d-9ab7-ad7bc1fbae99.question: During the work of care and attention to patients, the bioethical principles of autonomy, justice, non-maleficence, and beneficence can conflict. Indicate the correct answer:

options.A: The bioethical principles of autonomy and beneficence will prevail in case of conflict with the bioethical principle of non-maleficence.
options.B: The principle of non-maleficence specifically determines the non-discrimination of any person in caregiving work, specially protecting those less fortunate individuals.
options.C: The principle of justice determines the personal freedom of each patient, who, well informed, decides on what is good for him.
options.D: The principle of non-maleficence will prevail if it conflicts with the bioethical principle of beneficence.

05b7e673-aba7-4fd9-816e-bdc098dd2d7d.question: Indicate the correct answer regarding the Organic Law 3/2021, of March 24, on the regulation of euthanasia:

options.A: Palliative care is protected and considered throughout the entire patient care process, and its implementation is restricted in case of an official request for euthanasia by the patient.
options.B: The provision of aid for dying is not part of the benefits provided by the national health system except in cases where the patient is receiving palliative care.
options.C: The decision-making autonomy of the individual must be respected at all times, except in cases where such a decision contradicts the recommendations and clinical criteria of the healthcare staff.
options.D: Informing the patient about their health situation is an obligation on the part of the medical staff and a right of each patient, except in the case where the patient refuses to be informed.

5ceb3e4b-b436-4260-8bef-f9d82ae7591f.question: In accordance with the provisions of Law 14/2007, of July 3, on Biomedical Research, in the case of research with cells and tissues intended for application in humans, the data to ensure traceability must be retained for at least:

9f0af0fc-5d5b-420f-b50c-b3d812fcca2a.question: According to Royal Decree 1591/2009, of October 16, which regulates medical products, the "CE" conformity marking will be:

options.A: Recommended in case of manufacturers from the European Union.
options.B: Mandatory for all medical products manufactured outside of the European Union.
options.C: Mandatory for all healthcare products, except for custom-made products and those intended for scientific research.
options.D: Mandatory for products intended for scientific research.

10ebcc91-bc02-4421-b9a5-3d60f7750f12.question: The use of a technique, technology, or procedure to determine its degree of safety, efficacy, effectiveness, and efficiency before deciding on the appropriateness or need for its effective inclusion in the service portfolio of the National Health System is called:

3d31dcde-4533-4e43-b69b-cc5eccaaa56f.question: The difference between PROM and PREM indicators is based on the fact that:

options.A: The PROMs are measured using the PaRIS Survey ("Patient-Reported Indicator Surveys") and the PREMs using the BeRLIn Survey ("Best Reports Leading Indicators).
options.B: The PROMs are questionnaires that collect patient-reported outcomes and the PREMs are questionnaires that collect patient-reported experiences.
options.C: The objective of PROMs is to understand the patients' target health status, and the aim of PREMs is to understand their subjective health status.
options.D: PREMs allow for comparisons between patients' health status, while PROMs enable understanding of the patient's satisfaction.

b6419733-0e34-4636-bcfb-2fb0b1a2244b.question: Indicate the correct answer regarding the characteristics of tropomyosin in skeletal muscle:

options.A: Tropomyosin is a key neurotransmitter in muscle contraction.
options.B: Tropomyosin is a key hormone in muscle contraction.
options.C: Tropomyosin closely depends on the concentration of phosphorus in the muscle cell to perform its function.
options.D: Tropomyosin closely depends on the concentration of calcium in the muscle cell to perform its function.

331d331c-1081-4922-bd7f-e0d0249c56ba.question: Indicate which of the following statements best describes the role of senescent cells in the development of sarcopenia:

options.A: Senescent cells secrete inflammatory factors, known as "SenescenceAssociated Secretory Phenotype" (SASP), which can trigger a chronic inflammatory response in the muscle and exacerbate sarcopenia.
options.B: The effects of the Senescence-Associated Secretory Phenotype (SASP) on cellular behavior in the context of tumor progression have not been demonstrated.
options.C: The process for selectively eliminating senescent cells is called phenolysis and represents a potential strategy that can prevent or reverse sarcopenia.
options.D: In sarcopenia, the increase of senescent cells in muscle tissue contributes to greater stimulation of the m-Tor anabolic pathway.

422de12c-c3ca-46c4-bf2a-248f188603b8.question: Indicate which of the following B group vitamins plays an important role in the metabolism of amino acids and the synthesis of neurotransmitters such as serotonin and dopamine:

4b7baf9b-f8f9-4002-bfc8-0f4a6c31d21a.question: The GNEAUPP proposes the following definition for moisture-related injuries:

options.A: A localized lesion on the skin (usually does not affect underlying tissues) that presents as inflammation (erythema) and/or erosion of it, caused by prolonged exposure (continuous or nearly continuous) to various sources of moisture with potential for skin irritation (for example: urine, feces, wound exudate, effluents from stomas or fistulas, sweat, saliva or mucus).
options.B: A localized injury to the skin and deep tissues that presents as inflammation (erythema) and/or erosion of the skin, caused by prolonged exposure (continuous or almost continuous) to various sources of moisture with potential irritants for the skin (for example: urine, feces, wound exudate, effluents from stomas or fistulas, sweat, saliva or mucus).
options.C: Localized injury to the skin (usually does not affect underlying tissues) that always presents with erosion of the skin, caused by prolonged exposure (continuous or almost continuous) to various sources of moisture with potential irritants for the skin (for example: urine, feces, wound exudate, effluents from stomas or fistulas, sweat, saliva or mucus).
options.D: A localized injury to the skin and deep tissues appearing as an inflammation (erythema), caused by the devitalization of tissue as a result of the loss of cellular turgor due to prolonged exposure to various irritants (physical or chemical).

1039327f-347a-4262-9d9c-45c24d228004.question: Hypothermia is a common condition in maritime rescues of immigrants in damaged boats. Regarding the characteristics of it and its treatment, indicate the incorrect answer:

77f936a4-2ad1-4987-9ac5-169d6b8a93cc.question: Regarding the goal of treating frostbite in the extremities, indicate the incorrect answer:

e1c31927-55cc-43e6-b1c7-5c312e5bfae8.question: Indicate the incorrect option in relation to the side effects of patients undergoing radiotherapy for neck and head pathologies:

eb80c3e4-bd82-4038-b3ee-2196038d7cbb.question: Indicate the correct option in relation to the treatment of a jellyfish sting:

options.C: Disinfect the area with 2% chlorhexidine and subsequently wash the area with fresh water, without rubbing. The use of prophylactic antibiotics is recommended.

5d0ca948-400e-4d90-89bb-c07d8a32f052.question: The Organic Law 3/2018, of December 5, on Personal Data Protection and Guarantee of Digital Rights, is very clear in the protection of especially sensitive data such as biomedical data. Indicate the correct answer in relation to this protection:

ec64fccf-e2bd-40ac-806b-b9b7c26be714.question: Regarding the course of symptoms of the schizophrenia spectrum and other psychotic disorders, indicate the correct option (Austin et al., 2015; Haro et al., 2015; DSM-5):

options.A: Just over half of adult patients with a diagnosis of schizophrenia present persistent psychotic symptoms for an average of almost 10 years (Haro et al., 2015).

6a5340b3-70c5-4b4c-ae52-6d4637c69f86.question: In regards to the differential diagnosis of neurocognitive disorders, indicate the false answer:

b5452d71-da6c-4ecc-a2a9-f6fd6e0d72b7.question: Regarding the diagnosis of neurocognitive disorders, indicate the false answer:

3e8855ae-2e15-45bb-b8ad-41f56f014671.question: What is the objective of metatheoretical integration in psychotherapy?

d8364d82-8371-46d6-a6fc-814d659684d1.question: Recent studies from behavior analysis have highlighted the role that rule-governed behavior plays in the development of depression problems. What do the studies conducted on rule-governed behavior suggest?

366d4536-3869-4186-a0aa-a694b9fa55e6.question: Childhood trauma can manifest in very different ways depending on age or gender. Which of the following statements is there evidence for?:
